content: 1 Blessed is the man who does not walk in the advice of the wicked; nor does he stand in the way of sinners; nor does he sit in the assembly of mockers.
content_old: 1 Blessed is the man who does not walk in the advice of the wicked; nor does he stand in the way of sinners; nor does he sit in the assembly of mockers.

content: 2 Instead, in the law of Yahweh is his delight, and on his law he meditates day and night.
content_old: 2 Instead, in the law of Yahweh is his delight, and on his law he meditates day and night.

content: 3 And so, he is like a tree planted by streams of water that gives its fruit in its season; its leaf also does not wither. Therefore all that he does prospers.
content_old: 3 And so, he is like a tree planted by streams of water that gives its fruit in its season; its leaf also does not wither. Therefore all that he does prospers.

content: 4 Not so the wicked. Instead, they are like the chaff that the wind scatters.
content_old: 4 Not so the wicked. Instead, they are like the chaff that the wind scatters.

content: 5 Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous;
content_old: 5 Therefore the wicked will not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous;

content: 1 Why are nations in tumult, and countries plotting in vain?
content_old: 1 Why are nations in tumult, and countries plotting in vain?

content: 2 The kings of the earth establish themselves, and the rulers conspire together against Yahweh and his anointed:
content_old: 2 The kings of the earth establish themselves, and the rulers conspire together against Yahweh and his anointed:

content: 3 “Let us tear off their bonds, and cast their cords from us!”
content_old: 3 “Let us tear off their bonds, and cast their cords from us!”

content: 4 He who sits enthroned in the heavens laughs. The Lord derides them.
content_old: 4 He who sits enthroned in the heavens laughs. The Lord derides them.

content: 5 Then he speaks to them in his wrath, and in his fury he terrifies them:
content_old: 5 Then he speaks to them in his wrath, and in his fury he terrifies them:

content: 6 “But as for me, I have set my king on Zion, my holy mountain.”
content_old: 6 “But as for me, I have set my king on Zion, my holy mountain.”

content: 7 I will tell the decree; Yahweh said to me: “You are my son; today I have begotten you.
content_old: 7 I will tell the decree; Yahweh said to me: “You are my son; today I have begotten you.

content: 8 Ask from me and I will make the nations your heritage, and your possession the ends of the earth.
content_old: 8 Ask from me and I will make the nations your heritage, and your possession the ends of the earth.

content: 9 You will break them with an iron rod. Like a potter’s vessel you will shatter them.”
content_old: 9 You will break them with an iron rod. Like a potter’s vessel you will shatter them.”

content: 10 So then, O kings, be wise. Be warned, O rulers of the earth.
content_old: 10 So then, O kings, be wise. Be warned, O rulers of the earth.

content: 11 Serve Yahweh with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
content_old: 11 Serve Yahweh with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

content: A psalm of David at his fleeing from the presence of Absalom, his son.
content_old: A psalm of David at his fleeing from the presence of Absalom, his son.

content: 1 Yahweh, how many are my enemies; many are rising against me.
content_old: 1 Yahweh, how many are my enemies; many are rising against me.

content: 2 Many are saying about my soul, “There is no deliverance for him from God. Selah
content_old: 2 Many are saying about my soul, “There is no deliverance for him from God. Selah

content: 3 But you, Yahweh, are a shield around me, my glory and the one who lifts up my head.
content_old: 3 But you, Yahweh, are a shield around me, my glory and the one who lifts up my head.

content: 4 With my voice I call to Yahweh and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah
content_old: 4 With my voice I call to Yahweh and he answers me from his holy hill. Selah

content: 5 I lay down and slept; I woke up because Yahweh sustains me.
content_old: 5 I lay down and slept; I woke up because Yahweh sustains me.

content: 6 I am not afraid of the ten thousands of people who all around have set themselves against me.
content_old: 6 I am not afraid of the ten thousands of people who all around have set themselves against me.

content: 7 Rise up, O Yahweh; deliver me, O my God; for you strike all my enemies on the cheek. The teeth of the wicked you break.
content_old: 7 Rise up, O Yahweh; deliver me, O my God; for you strike all my enemies on the cheek. The teeth of the wicked you break.

content: For the music director; with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director; with stringed instruments. A psalm of David.

content: 1 When I call, answer me, O God of my righteousness. In trouble deliver me. Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.
content_old: 1 When I call, answer me, O God of my righteousness. In trouble deliver me. Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.

content: 2 O sons of man, how long will my honor be a disgrace? How long will you love vanity? How long will you seek lies? Selah
content_old: 2 O sons of man, how long will my honor be a disgrace? How long will you love vanity? How long will you seek lies? Selah

content: 3 But know that Yahweh has set apart for himself the faithful one. Yahweh hears when I call to him.
content_old: 3 But know that Yahweh has set apart for himself the faithful one. Yahweh hears when I call to him.

content: 4 Be disturbed but do not sin. Commune in your heart on your bed and be silent. Selah
content_old: 4 Be disturbed but do not sin. Commune in your heart on your bed and be silent. Selah

content: 5 Offer correct sacrifices, and trust in Yahweh.
content_old: 5 Offer correct sacrifices, and trust in Yahweh.

content: 6 Many are saying, “Who will show us something good?” Lift up over us the light of your face, O Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Many are saying, “Who will show us something good?” Lift up over us the light of your face, O Yahweh.

content: 7 You have put gladness in my heart more than when their grain and their wine abound.
content_old: 7 You have put gladness in my heart more than when their grain and their wine abound.

content: For the music director; with the flutes. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director; with the flutes. A psalm of David.

content: 1 Hear my words, O Yahweh. Give heed to my sighing.
content_old: 1 Hear my words, O Yahweh. Give heed to my sighing.

content: 2 Listen to the sound of my pleading, my king and my God, for to you I pray.
content_old: 2 Listen to the sound of my pleading, my king and my God, for to you I pray.

content: 3 O Yahweh, in the morning you will hear my voice. In the morning I will set forth my case to you and I will watch.
content_old: 3 O Yahweh, in the morning you will hear my voice. In the morning I will set forth my case to you and I will watch.

content: 4 For you are not a God who desires wickedness. Evil cannot dwell with you.
content_old: 4 For you are not a God who desires wickedness. Evil cannot dwell with you.

content: 5 The boastful do not stand before your eyes. You hate all evildoers.
content_old: 5 The boastful do not stand before your eyes. You hate all evildoers.

content: 6 You destroy speakers of lies. A man of bloodshed and deceit Yahweh abhors.
content_old: 6 You destroy speakers of lies. A man of bloodshed and deceit Yahweh abhors.

content: 7 But as for me, through the abundance of your steadfast love I will enter your house. I will bow down toward your holy temple in awe of you.
content_old: 7 But as for me, through the abundance of your steadfast love I will enter your house. I will bow down toward your holy temple in awe of you.

content: 8 O Yahweh, lead me in your righteousness because of my enemies; make straight before me your way.
content_old: 8 O Yahweh, lead me in your righteousness because of my enemies; make straight before me your way.

content: 9 For there is not anything reliable in his mouth; their inner part is destruction. Their throat is an open grave; with their tongue they speak deceit.
content_old: 9 For there is not anything reliable in his mouth; their inner part is destruction. Their throat is an open grave; with their tongue they speak deceit.

content: 10 Treat them as guilty, O God; let them fall because of their plans. Because of the abundance of their transgressions cast them out, for they have rebelled against you.
content_old: 10 Treat them as guilty, O God; let them fall because of their plans. Because of the abundance of their transgressions cast them out, for they have rebelled against you.

content: 11 But let all who take shelter in you rejoice. Let them ever sing for joy, because you spread protection over them; And let those who love your name exult in you.
content_old: 11 But let all who take shelter in you rejoice. Let them ever sing for joy, because you spread protection over them; And let those who love your name exult in you.

content: For the music director; with stringed instruments, on the Sheminith. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director; with stringed instruments, on the Sheminith. A psalm of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger, and do not discipline me in your wrath.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, do not rebuke me in your anger, and do not discipline me in your wrath.

content: 2 Be gracious to me, O Yahweh, because I am feeble. Heal me, O Yahweh, for my bones are terrified.
content_old: 2 Be gracious to me, O Yahweh, because I am feeble. Heal me, O Yahweh, for my bones are terrified.

content: 3 My soul is also very terrified. But you, O Yahweh, how long?
content_old: 3 My soul is also very terrified. But you, O Yahweh, how long?

content: 4 Turn, O Yahweh; deliver my life. Save me for the sake of your steadfast love.
content_old: 4 Turn, O Yahweh; deliver my life. Save me for the sake of your steadfast love.

content: 5 For there is no remembrance of you in death. In Sheol, who will give thanks to you?
content_old: 5 For there is no remembrance of you in death. In Sheol, who will give thanks to you?

content: 6 I am weary with my groaning; I flood my bed every night. With my tears I drench my couch.
content_old: 6 I am weary with my groaning; I flood my bed every night. With my tears I drench my couch.

content: 7 My eye wastes away because of vexation; it grows old because of all my oppressors.
content_old: 7 My eye wastes away because of vexation; it grows old because of all my oppressors.

content: 8 Depart from me, all workers of evil, for Yahweh has heard the sound of my weeping.
content_old: 8 Depart from me, all workers of evil, for Yahweh has heard the sound of my weeping.

content: 9 Yahweh has heard my plea; Yahweh has accepted my prayer.
content_old: 9 Yahweh has heard my plea; Yahweh has accepted my prayer.

content: A Shiggaion of David which he sang to Yahweh on account of Cush, a Benjaminite.
content_old: A Shiggaion of David which he sang to Yahweh on account of Cush, a Benjaminite.

content: 1 O Yahweh, my God, in you I have taken refuge. Save me from all who pursue me, and deliver me.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, my God, in you I have taken refuge. Save me from all who pursue me, and deliver me.

content: 2 Or else he will tear me apart like a lion, ripping to pieces, with none to deliver.
content_old: 2 Or else he will tear me apart like a lion, ripping to pieces, with none to deliver.

content: 3 O Yahweh, my God, if I have done this, if there is wrong in my hands,
content_old: 3 O Yahweh, my God, if I have done this, if there is wrong in my hands,

content: 4 if I have repaid my ally with harm, or if I have plundered my enemy without cause,
content_old: 4 if I have repaid my ally with harm, or if I have plundered my enemy without cause,

content: 5 let the enemy of my soul pursue, and overtake and trample my life into the ground, and lay my honor in the dust. Selah
content_old: 5 let the enemy of my soul pursue, and overtake and trample my life into the ground, and lay my honor in the dust. Selah

content: 6 Rise up, O Yahweh, in your anger, and lift yourself up against the wrath of my oppressors, and awake for me, since you have commanded judgment.
content_old: 6 Rise up, O Yahweh, in your anger, and lift yourself up against the wrath of my oppressors, and awake for me, since you have commanded judgment.

content: 7 And let the assembly of peoples surround you, and over it return on high.
content_old: 7 And let the assembly of peoples surround you, and over it return on high.

content: 8 Yahweh judges the nations. O Yahweh, vindicate me according to my innocence and according to my integrity within me.
content_old: 8 Yahweh judges the nations. O Yahweh, vindicate me according to my innocence and according to my integrity within me.

content: 9 Let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous, and test the hearts and innermost being, O righteous God.
content_old: 9 Let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous, and test the hearts and innermost being, O righteous God.

content: 10 My shield is with God who saves the upright of heart.
content_old: 10 My shield is with God who saves the upright of heart.

content: 11 God is a righteous judge, and a God who has indignation every day.
content_old: 11 God is a righteous judge, and a God who has indignation every day.

content: 12 If he does not repent, he will sharpen his sword. He has bent his bow and he has strung it.
content_old: 12 If he does not repent, he will sharpen his sword. He has bent his bow and he has strung it.

content: 13 And he has prepared for him weapons of death. He has made his arrows fiery shafts.
content_old: 13 And he has prepared for him weapons of death. He has made his arrows fiery shafts.

content: 14 See, he travails with evil. He is pregnant with trouble, and he gives birth to deception.
content_old: 14 See, he travails with evil. He is pregnant with trouble, and he gives birth to deception.

content: 15 He makes a pit and digs it out, then falls in the trap he has made.
content_old: 15 He makes a pit and digs it out, then falls in the trap he has made.

content: 16 His trouble comes back on his head, and his violence comes down on his skull.
content_old: 16 His trouble comes back on his head, and his violence comes down on his skull.

content: For the music director, on the Gittith. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director, on the Gittith. A psalm of David.

content: 1 Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth, who put your splendor above the heavens.
content_old: 1 Yahweh, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth, who put your splendor above the heavens.

content: 2 From the mouth of children and infants you have founded strength on account of your enemies, to silence the enemy and the avenger.
content_old: 2 From the mouth of children and infants you have founded strength on account of your enemies, to silence the enemy and the avenger.

content: 3 When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and the stars which you set in place—
content_old: 3 When I look at your heavens, the work of your fingers, the moon and the stars which you set in place—

content: 4 what is a human being that you think of him? and a child of humankind that you care for him?
content_old: 4 what is a human being that you think of him? and a child of humankind that you care for him?

content: 5 And you made him a little lower than heavenly beings, and with glory and with majesty you crowned him.
content_old: 5 And you made him a little lower than heavenly beings, and with glory and with majesty you crowned him.

content: 6 You make him over the works of your hands; all things you have placed under his feet:
content_old: 6 You make him over the works of your hands; all things you have placed under his feet:

content: 7 sheep and cattle, all of them, and also the wild animals of the field,
content_old: 7 sheep and cattle, all of them, and also the wild animals of the field,

content: 8 the birds of the sky and the fish of the sea, everything that passes along the paths of seas.
content_old: 8 the birds of the sky and the fish of the sea, everything that passes along the paths of seas.

content: For the music director, according to Muth-labben. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director, according to Muth-labben. A psalm of David.

content: 1 I will thank Yahweh with all my heart. I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
content_old: 1 I will thank Yahweh with all my heart. I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.

content: 2 I will be glad and rejoice in you. I will sing the praise of your name, O Most High.
content_old: 2 I will be glad and rejoice in you. I will sing the praise of your name, O Most High.

content: 3 When my enemies turn back, they will stumble and perish because of your presence.
content_old: 3 When my enemies turn back, they will stumble and perish because of your presence.

content: 4 For you have maintained my just cause; you have sat on the throne judging correctly.
content_old: 4 For you have maintained my just cause; you have sat on the throne judging correctly.

content: 5 You have rebuked the nations; you have destroyed the wicked. Their name you have blotted out forever and ever.
content_old: 5 You have rebuked the nations; you have destroyed the wicked. Their name you have blotted out forever and ever.

content: 6 The enemies are destroyed in ruins forever, and you have uprooted their cities; their very memory has perished.
content_old: 6 The enemies are destroyed in ruins forever, and you have uprooted their cities; their very memory has perished.

content: 7 But Yahweh sits enthroned forever. He has established his throne for judgment.
content_old: 7 But Yahweh sits enthroned forever. He has established his throne for judgment.

content: 8 And he will judge the world with righteousness. He will judge the peoples with equity.
content_old: 8 And he will judge the world with righteousness. He will judge the peoples with equity.

content: 9 And Yahweh will be a stronghold for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of distress.
content_old: 9 And Yahweh will be a stronghold for the oppressed, a stronghold in times of distress.

content: 10 And those who know your name will trust in you, for you do not forsake those who seek you, O Yahweh.
content_old: 10 And those who know your name will trust in you, for you do not forsake those who seek you, O Yahweh.

content: 11 Sing praises to Yahweh who sits enthroned in Zion. Tell his deeds among the peoples,
content_old: 11 Sing praises to Yahweh who sits enthroned in Zion. Tell his deeds among the peoples,

content: 12 for he who avenges bloodshed remembers them. He does not forget the distressed cry of the afflicted.
content_old: 12 for he who avenges bloodshed remembers them. He does not forget the distressed cry of the afflicted.

content: 13 Be gracious to me, O Yahweh. See my suffering from those who hate me, you who lift me up from the gates of death,
content_old: 13 Be gracious to me, O Yahweh. See my suffering from those who hate me, you who lift me up from the gates of death,

content: 14 so that I may tell of all your praises. In the gates of the daughter of Zion let me rejoice in your salvation.
content_old: 14 so that I may tell of all your praises. In the gates of the daughter of Zion let me rejoice in your salvation.

content: 15 The nations have fallen in the pit that they made; their foot is caught in the net that they hid.
content_old: 15 The nations have fallen in the pit that they made; their foot is caught in the net that they hid.

content: 16 Yahweh has made himself known; he has executed judgment. The wicked is snared by the work of his hands. Higgaion Selah
content_old: 16 Yahweh has made himself known; he has executed judgment. The wicked is snared by the work of his hands. Higgaion Selah

content: 17 The wicked shall turn back to Sheol, all the nations forgetting God,
content_old: 17 The wicked shall turn back to Sheol, all the nations forgetting God,

content: 18 for the needy shall not always be forgotten; the hope of the poor shall never perish.
content_old: 18 for the needy shall not always be forgotten; the hope of the poor shall never perish.

content: 19 Rise up, O Yahweh, let not humans prevail; let the nations be judged before you.
content_old: 19 Rise up, O Yahweh, let not humans prevail; let the nations be judged before you.

content: 1 Why, O Yahweh, do you stand far off? Why do you hide during times of distress?
content_old: 1 Why, O Yahweh, do you stand far off? Why do you hide during times of distress?

content: 2 In arrogance the wicked persecutes the poor. Let them be caught in the schemes that they devised,
content_old: 2 In arrogance the wicked persecutes the poor. Let them be caught in the schemes that they devised,

content: 3 for the wicked boasts about the desire of his heart, and the one greedy for gain curses and treats Yahweh with contempt.
content_old: 3 for the wicked boasts about the desire of his heart, and the one greedy for gain curses and treats Yahweh with contempt.

content: 4 With bald-faced pride the wicked will not seek God. There is no God in any of his thoughts.
content_old: 4 With bald-faced pride the wicked will not seek God. There is no God in any of his thoughts.

content: 5 His ways endure at all times. Your judgments are aloof from him. As for all his enemies, he scoffs at them.
content_old: 5 His ways endure at all times. Your judgments are aloof from him. As for all his enemies, he scoffs at them.

content: 6 He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved throughout all generations, during which I will have no trouble.”
content_old: 6 He says in his heart, “I shall not be moved throughout all generations, during which I will have no trouble.”

content: 7 His mouth is filled with cursing, with deceits and oppression; under his tongue are trouble and evil.
content_old: 7 His mouth is filled with cursing, with deceits and oppression; under his tongue are trouble and evil.

content: 8 He sits in ambush in villages; in the hiding places he kills the innocent. His eyes lurk for the helpless.
content_old: 8 He sits in ambush in villages; in the hiding places he kills the innocent. His eyes lurk for the helpless.

content: 9 He lies in ambush secretly, like a lion in a thicket. He lies in ambush to seize the poor; he seizes the poor by catching him in his net.
content_old: 9 He lies in ambush secretly, like a lion in a thicket. He lies in ambush to seize the poor; he seizes the poor by catching him in his net.

content: 10 He is crushed; he is bowed down; so the helpless host falls by his might.
content_old: 10 He is crushed; he is bowed down; so the helpless host falls by his might.

content: 11 He says in his heart, “God has forgotten. He has hidden his face. He never sees.”
content_old: 11 He says in his heart, “God has forgotten. He has hidden his face. He never sees.”

content: 12 Rise up, O Yahweh; O God, lift up your hand. Do not forget the afflicted.
content_old: 12 Rise up, O Yahweh; O God, lift up your hand. Do not forget the afflicted.

content: 13 Why does the wicked treat God with contempt? He says in his heart, “You will not call me to account.”
content_old: 13 Why does the wicked treat God with contempt? He says in his heart, “You will not call me to account.”

content: 14 But you have seen; indeed you have noted trouble and grief to take it into your hand. The helpless abandons himself upon you; you have been the helper for the orphan.
content_old: 14 But you have seen; indeed you have noted trouble and grief to take it into your hand. The helpless abandons himself upon you; you have been the helper for the orphan.

content: 15 Break the arm of the wicked, and as for the evil man— seek out his wickedness until you find none.
content_old: 15 Break the arm of the wicked, and as for the evil man— seek out his wickedness until you find none.

content: 16 Yahweh is king forever and ever; the nations have perished from his land.
content_old: 16 Yahweh is king forever and ever; the nations have perished from his land.

content: 17 The longing of the afflicted you have heard, O Yahweh. You will make their heart secure. You will listen attentively
content_old: 17 The longing of the afflicted you have heard, O Yahweh. You will make their heart secure. You will listen attentively

content: For the music director. Of David.
content_old: For the music director. Of David.

content: 1 In Yahweh I have taken refuge; how can you say to my soul, “Flee to your mountain like a bird”?
content_old: 1 In Yahweh I have taken refuge; how can you say to my soul, “Flee to your mountain like a bird”?

content: 2 For look: The wicked string the bow. They have fitted their arrow to the string, to shoot from the darkness at the upright of heart.
content_old: 2 For look: The wicked string the bow. They have fitted their arrow to the string, to shoot from the darkness at the upright of heart.

content: 3 When the foundations are destroyed what can the righteous do?
content_old: 3 When the foundations are destroyed what can the righteous do?

content: 4 Yahweh is in his holy temple; Yahweh is in the heavens on his throne. His eyelids see; they test the children of humankind.
content_old: 4 Yahweh is in his holy temple; Yahweh is in the heavens on his throne. His eyelids see; they test the children of humankind.

content: 5 Yahweh tests the righteous, but the wicked and the lover of violence his soul hates.
content_old: 5 Yahweh tests the righteous, but the wicked and the lover of violence his soul hates.

content: 6 He will rain coals on the wicked. Burning sulfur and scorching wind will be the portion of their cup.
content_old: 6 He will rain coals on the wicked. Burning sulfur and scorching wind will be the portion of their cup.

content: For the music director; on the Sheminith. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director; on the Sheminith. A psalm of David.

content: 1 Save, O Yahweh, for the pious have ceased to be; for the faithful have vanished from among the children of humankind.
content_old: 1 Save, O Yahweh, for the pious have ceased to be; for the faithful have vanished from among the children of humankind.

content: 2 They speak falseness to each other. With flattering lips, with a double heart they speak.
content_old: 2 They speak falseness to each other. With flattering lips, with a double heart they speak.

content: 3 May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips, the tongue speaking great boasts—
content_old: 3 May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips, the tongue speaking great boasts—

content: 4 those who say, “With our tongue we will prevail. Our lips are on our side. Who is master over us?”
content_old: 4 those who say, “With our tongue we will prevail. Our lips are on our side. Who is master over us?”

content: 5 “Because of the oppression of the afflicted, because of the groaning of the poor, now I will rise up,” Yahweh says. “I shall put them in the safety for which they long.”
content_old: 5 “Because of the oppression of the afflicted, because of the groaning of the poor, now I will rise up,” Yahweh says. “I shall put them in the safety for which they long.”

content: 6 The words of Yahweh are pure words like silver refined in the crucible on the ground, refined seven times.
content_old: 6 The words of Yahweh are pure words like silver refined in the crucible on the ground, refined seven times.

content: 7 You, O Yahweh, will protect them. You will preserve him from this generation always.
content_old: 7 You, O Yahweh, will protect them. You will preserve him from this generation always.

content: For the music director. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director. A psalm of David.

content: 1 How long, O Yahweh? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?
content_old: 1 How long, O Yahweh? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?

content: 2 How long must I take counsel in my soul, and sorrow in my heart all the day? How long will my enemy be exalted over me?
content_old: 2 How long must I take counsel in my soul, and sorrow in my heart all the day? How long will my enemy be exalted over me?

content: 3 Consider and answer me, O Yahweh my God. Give light to my eyes lest I sleep the sleep of death,
content_old: 3 Consider and answer me, O Yahweh my God. Give light to my eyes lest I sleep the sleep of death,

content: 4 and lest my enemy should say, “I have overcome him,” lest my enemies rejoice because I am shaken.
content_old: 4 and lest my enemy should say, “I have overcome him,” lest my enemies rejoice because I am shaken.

content: 5 But as for me, I have trusted in your steadfast love. My heart will rejoice in your deliverance.
content_old: 5 But as for me, I have trusted in your steadfast love. My heart will rejoice in your deliverance.

content: For the music director. Of David.
content_old: For the music director. Of David.

content: 1 The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt. They do abominable deeds. There is none who does good.
content_old: 1 The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt. They do abominable deeds. There is none who does good.

content: 2 Yahweh looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind to see whether there is one who has insight, one who cares about God.
content_old: 2 Yahweh looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind to see whether there is one who has insight, one who cares about God.

content: 3 All have gone astray; they are altogether corrupt. There is not one who does good; there is not even one.
content_old: 3 All have gone astray; they are altogether corrupt. There is not one who does good; there is not even one.

content: 4 All who do evil—do they not know, they who eat my people as though they were eating bread? They do not call on Yahweh.
content_old: 4 All who do evil—do they not know, they who eat my people as though they were eating bread? They do not call on Yahweh.

content: 5 There they are very fearful because God is with the generation of the righteous.
content_old: 5 There they are very fearful because God is with the generation of the righteous.

content: 6 You would put to shame the plan of the poor, because Yahweh is his refuge.
content_old: 6 You would put to shame the plan of the poor, because Yahweh is his refuge.

content: A psalm of David.
content_old: A psalm of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh, who may reside in your tent? Who may dwell on your holy mountain?
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, who may reside in your tent? Who may dwell on your holy mountain?

content: 2 He who walks blamelessly and does what is right. He who speaks honestly in his heart.
content_old: 2 He who walks blamelessly and does what is right. He who speaks honestly in his heart.

content: 3 He does not slander with his tongue. He does not harm his friend, nor bring up a disgrace against his neighbor.
content_old: 3 He does not slander with his tongue. He does not harm his friend, nor bring up a disgrace against his neighbor.

content: 4 In his eyes a rejected one is contemptible, but he honors those who respect Yahweh. He takes an oath to his own injury and does not retract it.
content_old: 4 In his eyes a rejected one is contemptible, but he honors those who respect Yahweh. He takes an oath to his own injury and does not retract it.

content: A miktam of David.
content_old: A miktam of David.

content: 1 Protect me, O God, for I take refuge in you.
content_old: 1 Protect me, O God, for I take refuge in you.

content: 2 Oh my soul you have said to Yahweh, “You are my Lord. I have no good apart from you.”
content_old: 2 Oh my soul you have said to Yahweh, “You are my Lord. I have no good apart from you.”

content: 3 With regard to the saints who are in the land, they are the noble ones in whom is all my desire.
content_old: 3 With regard to the saints who are in the land, they are the noble ones in whom is all my desire.

content: 4 Those who hurry after another god increase their sorrows. I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood, nor take up their names on my lips.
content_old: 4 Those who hurry after another god increase their sorrows. I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood, nor take up their names on my lips.

content: 5 Yahweh is the portion which is my share and my cup. You hold my lot.
content_old: 5 Yahweh is the portion which is my share and my cup. You hold my lot.

content: 6 The measuring lines have fallen for me in pleasant places. Yes, my inheritance is delightful for me.
content_old: 6 The measuring lines have fallen for me in pleasant places. Yes, my inheritance is delightful for me.

content: 7 I will bless Yahweh who advises me; yes, at night my innermost being instructs me.
content_old: 7 I will bless Yahweh who advises me; yes, at night my innermost being instructs me.

content: 8 I have set Yahweh before me always. Because he is at my right hand I will not be shaken.
content_old: 8 I have set Yahweh before me always. Because he is at my right hand I will not be shaken.

content: 9 Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices. Yes, my body will dwell in safety,
content_old: 9 Therefore my heart is glad and my glory rejoices. Yes, my body will dwell in safety,

content: 10 for you will not abandon my soul to Sheol; you will not give your faithful one to see the grave.
content_old: 10 for you will not abandon my soul to Sheol; you will not give your faithful one to see the grave.

content: A prayer of David.
content_old: A prayer of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh, hear a just cause. Hear my cry; heed my prayer I make without deceitful lips.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, hear a just cause. Hear my cry; heed my prayer I make without deceitful lips.

content: 2 Let my vindication come forth from you; let your eyes see fairness.
content_old: 2 Let my vindication come forth from you; let your eyes see fairness.

content: 3 You have tried my heart; you have examined me by night; you have tested me; you found nothing. I have decided that my mouth will not transgress.
content_old: 3 You have tried my heart; you have examined me by night; you have tested me; you found nothing. I have decided that my mouth will not transgress.

content: 4 As for the works of humankind, by the word of your lips, I have kept from the ways of the violent.
content_old: 4 As for the works of humankind, by the word of your lips, I have kept from the ways of the violent.

content: 5 I have held my steps in your path My feet will not slip.
content_old: 5 I have held my steps in your path My feet will not slip.

content: 6 As for me, I have called on you because you will answer me, O God. Incline your ear to me. Hear my words.
content_old: 6 As for me, I have called on you because you will answer me, O God. Incline your ear to me. Hear my words.

content: 7 Show wondrously your acts of loyal love, O Savior of those who take refuge at your right hand from those who rise up against them.
content_old: 7 Show wondrously your acts of loyal love, O Savior of those who take refuge at your right hand from those who rise up against them.

content: 8 Keep me as the apple of your eye. Hide me in the shadow of your wings
content_old: 8 Keep me as the apple of your eye. Hide me in the shadow of your wings

content: 9 from the presence of the wicked who destroy me, those enemies against my life, they that surround me.
content_old: 9 from the presence of the wicked who destroy me, those enemies against my life, they that surround me.

content: 10 They have shut off their calloused heart; with their mouth they speak arrogantly.
content_old: 10 They have shut off their calloused heart; with their mouth they speak arrogantly.

content: 11 Now they surround us at our every step. They intend to pin me to the ground.
content_old: 11 Now they surround us at our every step. They intend to pin me to the ground.

content: 12 He is like a lion; he longs to tear apart, and like a strong lion crouching in hiding places.
content_old: 12 He is like a lion; he longs to tear apart, and like a strong lion crouching in hiding places.

content: 13 Rise up, O Yahweh, confront him. Make him bow down. Rescue with your sword my life from the wicked,
content_old: 13 Rise up, O Yahweh, confront him. Make him bow down. Rescue with your sword my life from the wicked,

content: 14 from men by your hand, O Yahweh, from men of this world. Their share is in this life, and you fill their stomach with your treasure. They are satisfied with children. They bequeath their excess to their children.
content_old: 14 from men by your hand, O Yahweh, from men of this world. Their share is in this life, and you fill their stomach with your treasure. They are satisfied with children. They bequeath their excess to their children.

content: For the music director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh, who spoke to Yahweh the words of this song when Yahweh delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul.
content_old: For the music director. Of David, the servant of Yahweh, who spoke to Yahweh the words of this song when Yahweh delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul.

content: 1 And he said: “I love you, O Yahweh, my strength.”
content_old: 1 And he said: “I love you, O Yahweh, my strength.”

content: 2 Yahweh is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer, my God, my rock in whom I have taken refuge, my shield and the horn of my deliverance, my stronghold.
content_old: 2 Yahweh is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer, my God, my rock in whom I have taken refuge, my shield and the horn of my deliverance, my stronghold.

content: 3 I called upon Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised, and I was saved from my enemies.
content_old: 3 I called upon Yahweh, who is worthy to be praised, and I was saved from my enemies.

content: 4 The ropes of death encircled me, and streams of ruin overwhelmed me.
content_old: 4 The ropes of death encircled me, and streams of ruin overwhelmed me.

content: 5 The ropes of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of death confronted me.
content_old: 5 The ropes of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of death confronted me.

content: 6 In my trouble I called on Yahweh, and to my God I cried for help. He heard my voice from his temple, and my cry for help came up before his presence into his ears.
content_old: 6 In my trouble I called on Yahweh, and to my God I cried for help. He heard my voice from his temple, and my cry for help came up before his presence into his ears.

content: 7 Then the earth shook and quaked, and the foundations of the mountains trembled, and they staggered because he was angry.
content_old: 7 Then the earth shook and quaked, and the foundations of the mountains trembled, and they staggered because he was angry.

content: 8 Smoke went forth from his nose, and fire from his mouth consumed. Burning coals blazed from him.
content_old: 8 Smoke went forth from his nose, and fire from his mouth consumed. Burning coals blazed from him.

content: 9 So he bowed the heavens and came down with a thick cloud under his feet.
content_old: 9 So he bowed the heavens and came down with a thick cloud under his feet.

content: 10 And he mounted a cherub and flew, and he swooped down on wings of wind.
content_old: 10 And he mounted a cherub and flew, and he swooped down on wings of wind.

content: 11 He made darkness his hiding place; all about him his covering was a darkness of waters, thick clouds.
content_old: 11 He made darkness his hiding place; all about him his covering was a darkness of waters, thick clouds.

content: 12 From the brightness before him his clouds passed over with hail and coals of fire.
content_old: 12 From the brightness before him his clouds passed over with hail and coals of fire.

content: 13 And Yahweh thundered from the heavens, and the Most High uttered his voice with hail and coals of fire.
content_old: 13 And Yahweh thundered from the heavens, and the Most High uttered his voice with hail and coals of fire.

content: 14 And he shot his arrows and scattered them, and many lightning bolts and routed them.
content_old: 14 And he shot his arrows and scattered them, and many lightning bolts and routed them.

content: 15 Then the channels of the sea became visible, and the foundations of the world were uncovered by your rebuke, O Yahweh, by the blast of the wind of your nose.
content_old: 15 Then the channels of the sea became visible, and the foundations of the world were uncovered by your rebuke, O Yahweh, by the blast of the wind of your nose.

content: 16 He reached from on high; he seized me. He drew me from many waters.
content_old: 16 He reached from on high; he seized me. He drew me from many waters.

content: 17 He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from those who hated me because they were stronger than I.
content_old: 17 He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from those who hated me because they were stronger than I.

content: 18 They confronted me on the day of disaster, but Yahweh was my support.
content_old: 18 They confronted me on the day of disaster, but Yahweh was my support.

content: 19 So he brought me out to a spacious place. He delivered me because he delighted in me.
content_old: 19 So he brought me out to a spacious place. He delivered me because he delighted in me.

content: 20 Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness; According to the cleanness of my hands he has repaid me.
content_old: 20 Yahweh has rewarded me according to my righteousness; According to the cleanness of my hands he has repaid me.

content: 21 Because I have kept the ways of Yahweh, and have not acted wickedly against my God,
content_old: 21 Because I have kept the ways of Yahweh, and have not acted wickedly against my God,

content: 22 because all his ordinances are before me, and his statutes I have not removed from me,
content_old: 22 because all his ordinances are before me, and his statutes I have not removed from me,

content: 23 and I was blameless before him, and I kept myself from my guilt.
content_old: 23 and I was blameless before him, and I kept myself from my guilt.

content: 24 Therefore Yahweh has repaid me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.
content_old: 24 Therefore Yahweh has repaid me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his sight.

content: 25 To the loyal you show yourself loyal. To the blameless you show yourself blameless.
content_old: 25 To the loyal you show yourself loyal. To the blameless you show yourself blameless.

content: 26 To the pure you show yourself pure. but to the wicked you show yourself shrewd.
content_old: 26 To the pure you show yourself pure. but to the wicked you show yourself shrewd.

content: 27 For you deliver humble people, but haughty eyes you humiliate.
content_old: 27 For you deliver humble people, but haughty eyes you humiliate.

content: 28 For you light my lamp; Yahweh, my God, lights up my darkness.
content_old: 28 For you light my lamp; Yahweh, my God, lights up my darkness.

content: 29 For with you I can charge a troop, and with my God I can scale a wall.
content_old: 29 For with you I can charge a troop, and with my God I can scale a wall.

content: 30 This God—his way is blameless. The word of Yahweh is flawless. He is a shield for all those who take refuge in him.
content_old: 30 This God—his way is blameless. The word of Yahweh is flawless. He is a shield for all those who take refuge in him.

content: 31 For who is God apart from Yahweh, and who is a rock except our God?
content_old: 31 For who is God apart from Yahweh, and who is a rock except our God?

content: 32 The God who girded me with strength, and made safe my way,
content_old: 32 The God who girded me with strength, and made safe my way,

content: 33 he made my feet like the deer’s, and on my high places he makes me stand.
content_old: 33 he made my feet like the deer’s, and on my high places he makes me stand.

content: 34 He trains my hands for war, so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
content_old: 34 He trains my hands for war, so that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

content: 35 You also gave me the shield of your salvation, and your right hand supported me, and your humility made me great.
content_old: 35 You also gave me the shield of your salvation, and your right hand supported me, and your humility made me great.

content: 36 You enlarged my step under me, and my ankles did not slip.
content_old: 36 You enlarged my step under me, and my ankles did not slip.

content: 37 I chased my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back until they were finished off.
content_old: 37 I chased my enemies and overtook them; I did not turn back until they were finished off.

content: 38 I struck them and they were not able to stand up; they fell under my feet.
content_old: 38 I struck them and they were not able to stand up; they fell under my feet.

content: 39 And you girded me with strength for the battle; those rising against me you made to kneel under me.
content_old: 39 And you girded me with strength for the battle; those rising against me you made to kneel under me.

content: 40 And you made my enemies turn their backs, then I destroyed those who hated me.
content_old: 40 And you made my enemies turn their backs, then I destroyed those who hated me.

content: 41 They cried out but there was no rescuer, even to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.
content_old: 41 They cried out but there was no rescuer, even to Yahweh, but he did not answer them.

content: 42 And I ground them like dust in the wind, I emptied them out like mud of the streets.
content_old: 42 And I ground them like dust in the wind, I emptied them out like mud of the streets.

content: 43 You rescued me from strife with people; you set me as head (over) nations. People I did not know served me;
content_old: 43 You rescued me from strife with people; you set me as head (over) nations. People I did not know served me;

content: 44 as soon as they heard, they obeyed me. The children of a foreign land feigned obedience before me.
content_old: 44 as soon as they heard, they obeyed me. The children of a foreign land feigned obedience before me.

content: 45 The children of a foreign land lost heart, and they came trembling from their strongholds.
content_old: 45 The children of a foreign land lost heart, and they came trembling from their strongholds.

content: 46 Yahweh lives, and blessed be my rock, and may the God of my salvation be exalted—
content_old: 46 Yahweh lives, and blessed be my rock, and may the God of my salvation be exalted—

content: 47 the God who executed vengeance for me, and subdued peoples under me,
content_old: 47 the God who executed vengeance for me, and subdued peoples under me,

content: 48 who delivered me from my enemies. Indeed, you exalted me higher than those who rose against me. You delivered me from the man of violence.
content_old: 48 who delivered me from my enemies. Indeed, you exalted me higher than those who rose against me. You delivered me from the man of violence.

content: 49 Therefore I will give thanks to you among the nations, O Yahweh, and I will sing the praise of your name:
content_old: 49 Therefore I will give thanks to you among the nations, O Yahweh, and I will sing the praise of your name:

content: For the music director. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director. A psalm of David.

content: 1 The heavens are telling the glory of God, and the firmament proclaims the work of his hands.
content_old: 1 The heavens are telling the glory of God, and the firmament proclaims the work of his hands.

content: 2 Every day they pour forth speech, and every night they tell knowledge.
content_old: 2 Every day they pour forth speech, and every night they tell knowledge.

content: 3 There is no speech and there are no words; their sound is inaudible.
content_old: 3 There is no speech and there are no words; their sound is inaudible.

content: 4 Yet in all the world their line goes out, and their words to the end of the world. In them he has pitched a tent for the sun,
content_old: 4 Yet in all the world their line goes out, and their words to the end of the world. In them he has pitched a tent for the sun,

content: 5 and it is like a bridegroom who comes out of his bridal chamber. It is glad like a strong man to run its course.
content_old: 5 and it is like a bridegroom who comes out of his bridal chamber. It is glad like a strong man to run its course.

content: 6 Its rising is from one end of the heavens and its circuit to the other end of them; and nothing is hidden from its heat.
content_old: 6 Its rising is from one end of the heavens and its circuit to the other end of them; and nothing is hidden from its heat.

content: 7 The law of Yahweh is perfect, reviving life. The testimony of Yahweh is firm, making wise the simple.
content_old: 7 The law of Yahweh is perfect, reviving life. The testimony of Yahweh is firm, making wise the simple.

content: 8 The precepts of Yahweh are right, making the heart rejoice. The command of Yahweh is pure, enlightening the eyes.
content_old: 8 The precepts of Yahweh are right, making the heart rejoice. The command of Yahweh is pure, enlightening the eyes.

content: 9 The fear of Yahweh is pure, enduring forever. The ordinances of Yahweh are true; they are righteous altogether,
content_old: 9 The fear of Yahweh is pure, enduring forever. The ordinances of Yahweh are true; they are righteous altogether,

content: 10 more desirable than gold, even much fine gold; and sweeter than honey, even honey in the comb.
content_old: 10 more desirable than gold, even much fine gold; and sweeter than honey, even honey in the comb.

content: 11 Moreover, your servant is warned by them; in keeping them is great reward.
content_old: 11 Moreover, your servant is warned by them; in keeping them is great reward.

content: 12 Who can perceive his errors? Acquit me from hidden faults.
content_old: 12 Who can perceive his errors? Acquit me from hidden faults.

content: 13 Also, keep back your servant from arrogant sins; let them not rule over me. Then I shall be blameless, and I shall be innocent of great transgression.
content_old: 13 Also, keep back your servant from arrogant sins; let them not rule over me. Then I shall be blameless, and I shall be innocent of great transgression.

content: For the music director. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director. A psalm of David.

content: 1 May Yahweh answer you in the day of trouble. May the name of Jacob’s God protect you.
content_old: 1 May Yahweh answer you in the day of trouble. May the name of Jacob’s God protect you.

content: 2 May he send you help from the sanctuary, and from Zion may he sustain you.
content_old: 2 May he send you help from the sanctuary, and from Zion may he sustain you.

content: 3 May he remember all your offerings, and your burnt offering may he regard favorably. Selah
content_old: 3 May he remember all your offerings, and your burnt offering may he regard favorably. Selah

content: 4 May he give to you your heart’s desire, and your every plan may he fulfill.
content_old: 4 May he give to you your heart’s desire, and your every plan may he fulfill.

content: 5 May we shout for joy over your victory, and in the name of our God may we set up banners. May Yahweh fulfill all your requests.
content_old: 5 May we shout for joy over your victory, and in the name of our God may we set up banners. May Yahweh fulfill all your requests.

content: 6 Now I know that Yahweh will help his anointed. He will answer him from his holy heaven with the victorious power of his right hand.
content_old: 6 Now I know that Yahweh will help his anointed. He will answer him from his holy heaven with the victorious power of his right hand.

content: 7 Some boast in chariots and others in horses, but we boast in the name of Yahweh, our God.
content_old: 7 Some boast in chariots and others in horses, but we boast in the name of Yahweh, our God.

content: 8 They will collapse and fall, and we will rise and stand firm.
content_old: 8 They will collapse and fall, and we will rise and stand firm.

content: For the music director. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director. A psalm of David.

content: 1 O Yahweh, the king will rejoice in your strength, and how greatly he will delight in your help.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, the king will rejoice in your strength, and how greatly he will delight in your help.

content: 2 You have given him the desire of his heart, and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah
content_old: 2 You have given him the desire of his heart, and have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah

content: 3 For you meet him with blessings of good things. You set on his head a crown of fine gold.
content_old: 3 For you meet him with blessings of good things. You set on his head a crown of fine gold.

content: 4 He asked life from you; you gave it to him— length of days forever and ever.
content_old: 4 He asked life from you; you gave it to him— length of days forever and ever.

content: 5 His honor is great because of your help. Splendor and majesty you have bestowed upon him.
content_old: 5 His honor is great because of your help. Splendor and majesty you have bestowed upon him.

content: 6 For you set on him blessings forever. You make him glad with the joy of your presence.
content_old: 6 For you set on him blessings forever. You make him glad with the joy of your presence.

content: 7 Because the king trusts Yahweh, and through the steadfast love of the Most High he shall not be moved.
content_old: 7 Because the king trusts Yahweh, and through the steadfast love of the Most High he shall not be moved.

content: 8 Your hand will find all your enemies; your right hand will find those who hate you.
content_old: 8 Your hand will find all your enemies; your right hand will find those who hate you.

content: 9 You will make them like your fiery furnace at the time of your appearance. Yahweh will swallow them in his wrath and fire will consume them.
content_old: 9 You will make them like your fiery furnace at the time of your appearance. Yahweh will swallow them in his wrath and fire will consume them.

content: 10 You will destroy their offspring from the earth, and their descendants from among the children of humankind.
content_old: 10 You will destroy their offspring from the earth, and their descendants from among the children of humankind.

content: 11 Though they have plotted evil against you, though they have planned a scheme, they will not prevail.
content_old: 11 Though they have plotted evil against you, though they have planned a scheme, they will not prevail.

content: 12 For you will turn them to flight; you will aim arrows on your bowstrings at their faces.
content_old: 12 For you will turn them to flight; you will aim arrows on your bowstrings at their faces.

content: For the music director; according to The Doe of the Dawn. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director; according to The Doe of the Dawn. A psalm of David.

content: 1 My God, my God why have you forsaken me? Why are you far from helping me, far from the words of my groaning?
content_old: 1 My God, my God why have you forsaken me? Why are you far from helping me, far from the words of my groaning?

content: 2 O my God, I call by day and you do not answer, and by night but I have no rest.
content_old: 2 O my God, I call by day and you do not answer, and by night but I have no rest.

content: 3 Yet you are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.
content_old: 3 Yet you are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.

content: 4 Our ancestors trusted you; they trusted and you delivered them.
content_old: 4 Our ancestors trusted you; they trusted and you delivered them.

content: 5 They cried to you and were saved; they trusted you and were not ashamed.
content_old: 5 They cried to you and were saved; they trusted you and were not ashamed.

content: 6 But I am a worm and not a man, scorned by humankind and despised by people.
content_old: 6 But I am a worm and not a man, scorned by humankind and despised by people.

content: 7 All who see me mock me. They open wide their lips; they shake the head, saying:
content_old: 7 All who see me mock me. They open wide their lips; they shake the head, saying:

content: 8 “He trusts Yahweh. Let him rescue him. Let him deliver him because he delights in him.”
content_old: 8 “He trusts Yahweh. Let him rescue him. Let him deliver him because he delights in him.”

content: 9 Yet you took me from the belly; you made me trust while on my mother’s breasts.
content_old: 9 Yet you took me from the belly; you made me trust while on my mother’s breasts.

content: 10 On you I was cast from the womb. From my mother’s belly you have been my God.
content_old: 10 On you I was cast from the womb. From my mother’s belly you have been my God.

content: 11 Do not be far from me because trouble is near; because there is no helper.
content_old: 11 Do not be far from me because trouble is near; because there is no helper.

content: 12 Many bulls have encircled me; mighty bulls of Bashan have surrounded me.
content_old: 12 Many bulls have encircled me; mighty bulls of Bashan have surrounded me.

content: 13 They open their mouth against me like a lion tearing and roaring.
content_old: 13 They open their mouth against me like a lion tearing and roaring.

content: 14 I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; it is melted within me.
content_old: 14 I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; it is melted within me.

content: 15 My strength is dry like a potsherd, and my tongue is sticking to my jaws; and you have placed me in the dust of death.
content_old: 15 My strength is dry like a potsherd, and my tongue is sticking to my jaws; and you have placed me in the dust of death.

content: 16 Because dogs have surrounded me; a gang of evildoers has encircled me. Like the lion they are at my hands and my feet.
content_old: 16 Because dogs have surrounded me; a gang of evildoers has encircled me. Like the lion they are at my hands and my feet.

content: 17 I can count all my bones; they gaze, they look at me.
content_old: 17 I can count all my bones; they gaze, they look at me.

content: 18 They divide my garments among them, and for my clothing they cast lots.
content_old: 18 They divide my garments among them, and for my clothing they cast lots.

content: 19 But you, O Yahweh, do not remain distant. O my help, hasten to help me.
content_old: 19 But you, O Yahweh, do not remain distant. O my help, hasten to help me.

content: 20 Rescue my life from the sword, my only life from the power of the dogs.
content_old: 20 Rescue my life from the sword, my only life from the power of the dogs.

content: 21 Save me from the mouth of the lion, and from the horns of the wild oxen answer me.
content_old: 21 Save me from the mouth of the lion, and from the horns of the wild oxen answer me.

content: 22 I will tell your name to my brothers; inside the assembly I will praise you.
content_old: 22 I will tell your name to my brothers; inside the assembly I will praise you.

content: 23 You who revere Yahweh, praise him! Glorify him, all you seed of Jacob, and be in awe of him, all you seed of Israel,
content_old: 23 You who revere Yahweh, praise him! Glorify him, all you seed of Jacob, and be in awe of him, all you seed of Israel,

content: 24 because he has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted, and has not hid his face from him; but he listened to him when he cried for help.
content_old: 24 because he has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted, and has not hid his face from him; but he listened to him when he cried for help.

content: 25 From you is my praise. In the great assembly, I will pay my vows before those who revere him.
content_old: 25 From you is my praise. In the great assembly, I will pay my vows before those who revere him.

content: 26 The afflicted will eat and will be satisfied. Those who seek him will praise Yahweh. May your heart live forever.
content_old: 26 The afflicted will eat and will be satisfied. Those who seek him will praise Yahweh. May your heart live forever.

content: 27 All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to Yahweh. All the families of the nations will worship before you.
content_old: 27 All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to Yahweh. All the families of the nations will worship before you.

content: 28 Because the kingship belongs to Yahweh, and he rules over the nations.
content_old: 28 Because the kingship belongs to Yahweh, and he rules over the nations.

content: 29 All the healthy ones of the earth will eat and worship. Before him all of those descending into the dust will kneel, even he who cannot keep his soul alive.
content_old: 29 All the healthy ones of the earth will eat and worship. Before him all of those descending into the dust will kneel, even he who cannot keep his soul alive.

content: 30 Descendants will serve him. Regarding the Lord, it will be told to the next generation.
content_old: 30 Descendants will serve him. Regarding the Lord, it will be told to the next generation.

content: A psalm of David.
content_old: A psalm of David.

content: 1 Yahweh is my shepherd; I will not lack for anything.
content_old: 1 Yahweh is my shepherd; I will not lack for anything.

content: 2 In grassy pastures he makes me lie down; by quiet waters he leads me.
content_old: 2 In grassy pastures he makes me lie down; by quiet waters he leads me.

content: 3 He restores my life. He leads me in correct paths for the sake of his name.
content_old: 3 He restores my life. He leads me in correct paths for the sake of his name.

content: 4 Even when I walk in a dark valley, I fear no evil because you are with me. Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.
content_old: 4 Even when I walk in a dark valley, I fear no evil because you are with me. Your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

content: 5 You prepare before me a table in the presence of my oppressors. You anoint my head with oil; my cup is overflowing.
content_old: 5 You prepare before me a table in the presence of my oppressors. You anoint my head with oil; my cup is overflowing.

content: A psalm of David.
content_old: A psalm of David.

content: 1 The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness, the world and those who live in it,
content_old: 1 The earth is Yahweh’s, with its fullness, the world and those who live in it,

content: 2 because he has founded it on the seas, and has established it on the rivers.
content_old: 2 because he has founded it on the seas, and has established it on the rivers.

content: 3 Who may ascend the mountain of Yahweh? And who may stand in his holy place?
content_old: 3 Who may ascend the mountain of Yahweh? And who may stand in his holy place?

content: 4 He who is innocent of hands and pure of heart, who does not lift up his soul to falseness, and does not swear deceitfully.
content_old: 4 He who is innocent of hands and pure of heart, who does not lift up his soul to falseness, and does not swear deceitfully.

content: 5 He will receive blessing from Yahweh, and justice from the God of his salvation.
content_old: 5 He will receive blessing from Yahweh, and justice from the God of his salvation.

content: 6 Such is the sort of those who seek him, those who seek your face, even Jacob. Selah
content_old: 6 Such is the sort of those who seek him, those who seek your face, even Jacob. Selah

content: 7 Lift up your heads, O gates, and rise up, O ancient doorways, that the king of glory may enter.
content_old: 7 Lift up your heads, O gates, and rise up, O ancient doorways, that the king of glory may enter.

content: 8 Who is the king of glory? Yahweh, strong and mighty; Yahweh, mighty in war!
content_old: 8 Who is the king of glory? Yahweh, strong and mighty; Yahweh, mighty in war!

content: 9 Lift up your heads, O gates, and lift up, O ancient doorways, that the king of glory may enter.
content_old: 9 Lift up your heads, O gates, and lift up, O ancient doorways, that the king of glory may enter.

content: Of David.
content_old: Of David.

content: 1 To you, O Yahweh, I lift up my soul.
content_old: 1 To you, O Yahweh, I lift up my soul.

content: 2 O my God, I trust you; let me not be put to shame. Do not let my enemies exult over me.
content_old: 2 O my God, I trust you; let me not be put to shame. Do not let my enemies exult over me.

content: 3 Indeed, none who wait for you should be put to shame. Those who betray without cause should be put to shame.
content_old: 3 Indeed, none who wait for you should be put to shame. Those who betray without cause should be put to shame.

content: 4 Make me know your ways, O Yahweh. Teach me your paths.
content_old: 4 Make me know your ways, O Yahweh. Teach me your paths.

content: 5 Cause me to walk in your truth and teach me, because you are the God of my salvation. I await you all day long.
content_old: 5 Cause me to walk in your truth and teach me, because you are the God of my salvation. I await you all day long.

content: 6 Remember your compassion, O Yahweh, and your acts of loyal love, because they are from of old.
content_old: 6 Remember your compassion, O Yahweh, and your acts of loyal love, because they are from of old.

content: 7 Do not remember the sins of my youth or my transgressions. According to your loyal love remember me if you will, for the sake of your goodness, O Yahweh.
content_old: 7 Do not remember the sins of my youth or my transgressions. According to your loyal love remember me if you will, for the sake of your goodness, O Yahweh.

content: 8 Good and right is Yahweh; therefore he instructs sinners in the way.
content_old: 8 Good and right is Yahweh; therefore he instructs sinners in the way.

content: 9 He causes the humble to walk in justice, and teaches the humble his way.
content_old: 9 He causes the humble to walk in justice, and teaches the humble his way.

content: 10 All the paths of Yahweh are loyal love and faithfulness for those who keep his covenant and statutes.
content_old: 10 All the paths of Yahweh are loyal love and faithfulness for those who keep his covenant and statutes.

content: 11 Also, for the sake of your name, O Yahweh, forgive my sin, because it is great.
content_old: 11 Also, for the sake of your name, O Yahweh, forgive my sin, because it is great.

content: 12 Who is the man fearing Yahweh? He will instruct him in the way he should choose.
content_old: 12 Who is the man fearing Yahweh? He will instruct him in the way he should choose.

content: 13 His soul will lodge in prosperity, and his offspring will possess the land.
content_old: 13 His soul will lodge in prosperity, and his offspring will possess the land.

content: 14 Intimate fellowship with Yahweh is for those who fear him, and he makes known his covenant to them.
content_old: 14 Intimate fellowship with Yahweh is for those who fear him, and he makes known his covenant to them.

content: 15 My eyes are continually toward Yahweh, because he will take my feet from the net.
content_old: 15 My eyes are continually toward Yahweh, because he will take my feet from the net.

content: 16 Turn to me and have mercy on me because I am lonely and afflicted.
content_old: 16 Turn to me and have mercy on me because I am lonely and afflicted.

content: 17 Remove the troubles of my heart; bring me out from my distresses.
content_old: 17 Remove the troubles of my heart; bring me out from my distresses.

content: 18 Consider my affliction and trouble, and forgive all my sins.
content_old: 18 Consider my affliction and trouble, and forgive all my sins.

content: 19 Consider that my enemies are many, and they hate me with violent hatred.
content_old: 19 Consider that my enemies are many, and they hate me with violent hatred.

content: 20 Protect my life and deliver me. Let me not be put to shame, because I take shelter in you.
content_old: 20 Protect my life and deliver me. Let me not be put to shame, because I take shelter in you.

content: 21 Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, because I wait for you.
content_old: 21 Let integrity and uprightness preserve me, because I wait for you.

content: Of David.
content_old: Of David.

content: 1 Judge me, O Yahweh, because I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted Yahweh and not wavered.
content_old: 1 Judge me, O Yahweh, because I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted Yahweh and not wavered.

content: 2 Prove me, O Yahweh, and test me. Try my innermost being and my mind.
content_old: 2 Prove me, O Yahweh, and test me. Try my innermost being and my mind.

content: 3 Because your loyal love is before my eyes, and I walk about in your faithfulness.
content_old: 3 Because your loyal love is before my eyes, and I walk about in your faithfulness.

content: 4 I do not sit with deceitful people, nor will I go about with hypocrites.
content_old: 4 I do not sit with deceitful people, nor will I go about with hypocrites.

content: 5 I hate the crowd of evildoers, and with the wicked I will not sit.
content_old: 5 I hate the crowd of evildoers, and with the wicked I will not sit.

content: 6 I will wash my hands in innocence, and I will walk about your altar, O Yahweh,
content_old: 6 I will wash my hands in innocence, and I will walk about your altar, O Yahweh,

content: 7 to declare with a voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all your wondrous deeds.
content_old: 7 to declare with a voice of thanksgiving, and tell of all your wondrous deeds.

content: 8 O Yahweh, I love the dwelling of your house, and the place where your glory abides.
content_old: 8 O Yahweh, I love the dwelling of your house, and the place where your glory abides.

content: 9 Do not destroy me with the sinners, nor my life with men of bloodshed,
content_old: 9 Do not destroy me with the sinners, nor my life with men of bloodshed,

content: 10 in whose hands is an evil plan, and whose right hand is full of bribes.
content_old: 10 in whose hands is an evil plan, and whose right hand is full of bribes.

content: 11 But as for me, I will walk in my integrity. Redeem me and be gracious to me.
content_old: 11 But as for me, I will walk in my integrity. Redeem me and be gracious to me.

content: Of David.
content_old: Of David.

content: 1 Yahweh is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? Yahweh is the refuge of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
content_old: 1 Yahweh is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? Yahweh is the refuge of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

content: 2 When evildoers drew near against me to eat my flesh— my adversaries and my enemies who drew near to me— they themselves stumbled and fell.
content_old: 2 When evildoers drew near against me to eat my flesh— my adversaries and my enemies who drew near to me— they themselves stumbled and fell.

content: 3 Though an army encamp against me, my heart will not fear. Though war arise against me, even in this I will remain confident.
content_old: 3 Though an army encamp against me, my heart will not fear. Though war arise against me, even in this I will remain confident.

content: 4 One thing I have asked from Yahweh; it I will seek: that I may dwell in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of Yahweh, and to consider his temple.
content_old: 4 One thing I have asked from Yahweh; it I will seek: that I may dwell in the house of Yahweh all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of Yahweh, and to consider his temple.

content: 5 Because he will hide me in his shelter in the day of trouble. He will conceal me in the hiding place of his tent. He will set me high upon a rock.
content_old: 5 Because he will hide me in his shelter in the day of trouble. He will conceal me in the hiding place of his tent. He will set me high upon a rock.

content: 6 And now my head will be high over my enemies round about me. And I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to Yahweh.
content_old: 6 And now my head will be high over my enemies round about me. And I will offer in his tent sacrifices with shouts of joy. I will sing, yes, I will sing praises to Yahweh.

content: 7 Hear, O Yahweh, my voice when I call, and be gracious to me and answer me.
content_old: 7 Hear, O Yahweh, my voice when I call, and be gracious to me and answer me.

content: 8 On your behalf my heart says, “Seek my face.” Your face, O Yahweh, I do seek.
content_old: 8 On your behalf my heart says, “Seek my face.” Your face, O Yahweh, I do seek.

content: 9 Do not hide your face from me; do not turn your servant away in anger. You have been my help; do not abandon nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.
content_old: 9 Do not hide your face from me; do not turn your servant away in anger. You have been my help; do not abandon nor forsake me, O God of my salvation.

content: 10 If my father or my mother forsake me, then Yahweh will receive me.
content_old: 10 If my father or my mother forsake me, then Yahweh will receive me.

content: 11 Teach me, O Yahweh, your way, and lead me on a level path because of my enemies.
content_old: 11 Teach me, O Yahweh, your way, and lead me on a level path because of my enemies.

content: 12 Do not give me over to the desire of my enemies, because false witnesses have arisen against me, and each breathing out violence.
content_old: 12 Do not give me over to the desire of my enemies, because false witnesses have arisen against me, and each breathing out violence.

content: 13 Surely I believe that I will see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living.
content_old: 13 Surely I believe that I will see the goodness of Yahweh in the land of the living.

content: A psalm of David.
content_old: A psalm of David.

content: 1 To you, O Yahweh, I call. O my rock, do not be deaf to me. Or else, if you are silent to me, then I will become like those descending to the pit.
content_old: 1 To you, O Yahweh, I call. O my rock, do not be deaf to me. Or else, if you are silent to me, then I will become like those descending to the pit.

content: 2 Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your holy inner sanctuary.
content_old: 2 Hear the voice of my supplications when I cry to you for help, when I lift up my hands toward your holy inner sanctuary.

content: 3 Do not drag me away with the wicked or with the workers of evil, who speak of peace with their neighbors, while evil is in their heart.
content_old: 3 Do not drag me away with the wicked or with the workers of evil, who speak of peace with their neighbors, while evil is in their heart.

content: 4 Give to them according to their work, even according to the evil of their deeds. Give to them according to the work of their hands; repay them their rightful due.
content_old: 4 Give to them according to their work, even according to the evil of their deeds. Give to them according to the work of their hands; repay them their rightful due.

content: 5 Because they do not regard the works of Yahweh, nor the work of his hands, he will destroy them and not rebuild them.
content_old: 5 Because they do not regard the works of Yahweh, nor the work of his hands, he will destroy them and not rebuild them.

content: 6 Blessed is Yahweh, because he has heard the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 Blessed is Yahweh, because he has heard the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 Yahweh is my strength and my shield. My heart trusts him and I am helped. So my heart rejoices, and with my song I will give thanks to him.
content_old: 7 Yahweh is my strength and my shield. My heart trusts him and I am helped. So my heart rejoices, and with my song I will give thanks to him.

content: 8 Yahweh is their strength, and he is the refuge for the salvation of his anointed one.
content_old: 8 Yahweh is their strength, and he is the refuge for the salvation of his anointed one.

content: A psalm of David.
content_old: A psalm of David.

content: 1 Ascribe to Yahweh, O sons of God, ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
content_old: 1 Ascribe to Yahweh, O sons of God, ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.

content: 2 Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due his name. Worship Yahweh in holy array.
content_old: 2 Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due his name. Worship Yahweh in holy array.

content: 3 The voice of Yahweh is over the waters; the God of glory thunders. Yahweh is over many waters.
content_old: 3 The voice of Yahweh is over the waters; the God of glory thunders. Yahweh is over many waters.

content: 4 The voice of Yahweh is powerful. The voice of Yahweh is majestic.
content_old: 4 The voice of Yahweh is powerful. The voice of Yahweh is majestic.

content: 5 The voice of Yahweh breaks the cedars. Yahweh shatters even the cedars of Lebanon.
content_old: 5 The voice of Yahweh breaks the cedars. Yahweh shatters even the cedars of Lebanon.

content: 6 And he makes them skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.
content_old: 6 And he makes them skip like a calf; Lebanon and Sirion like a young wild ox.

content: 7 The voice of Yahweh flashes flames of fire.
content_old: 7 The voice of Yahweh flashes flames of fire.

content: 8 The voice of Yahweh shakes the wilderness. Yahweh shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.
content_old: 8 The voice of Yahweh shakes the wilderness. Yahweh shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

content: 9 The voice of Yahweh causes deer to give birth and strips the forests bare. And at his temple all in it say, “Glory!”
content_old: 9 The voice of Yahweh causes deer to give birth and strips the forests bare. And at his temple all in it say, “Glory!”

content: 10 Yahweh sits enthroned at the flood, and Yahweh sits as king forever.
content_old: 10 Yahweh sits enthroned at the flood, and Yahweh sits as king forever.

content: A psalm; a song for the dedication of the house. Of David.
content_old: A psalm; a song for the dedication of the house. Of David.

content: 1 I will exalt you, O Yahweh, because you have drawn me up, and have not made my enemies rejoice over me.
content_old: 1 I will exalt you, O Yahweh, because you have drawn me up, and have not made my enemies rejoice over me.

content: 2 O Yahweh, my God, I cried for help to you, and you healed me.
content_old: 2 O Yahweh, my God, I cried for help to you, and you healed me.

content: 3 O Yahweh, you have brought my life up from Sheol. You preserved me alive from among those going down to the pit.
content_old: 3 O Yahweh, you have brought my life up from Sheol. You preserved me alive from among those going down to the pit.

content: 4 Sing praises to Yahweh, you his faithful ones, and give thanks to his holy fame.
content_old: 4 Sing praises to Yahweh, you his faithful ones, and give thanks to his holy fame.

content: 5 For there is a moment in his anger; there is a lifetime in his favor. Weeping lodges for the evening, but in the morning comes rejoicing.
content_old: 5 For there is a moment in his anger; there is a lifetime in his favor. Weeping lodges for the evening, but in the morning comes rejoicing.

content: 6 But as for me, I had said in my prosperity, “I shall not be moved ever.”
content_old: 6 But as for me, I had said in my prosperity, “I shall not be moved ever.”
