content: For the music director. A maskil of David. When Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul. And he said to him, “David has come to the house of Ahimelech.”
content_old: For the music director. A maskil of David. When Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul. And he said to him, “David has come to the house of Ahimelech.”

content: 1 Why do you boast about evil, O mighty man? The loyal love of God endures continually.
content_old: 1 Why do you boast about evil, O mighty man? The loyal love of God endures continually.

content: 2 Your tongue plans destruction, like a sharp razor, working deceit.
content_old: 2 Your tongue plans destruction, like a sharp razor, working deceit.

content: 3 You love evil more than good, a lie more than speaking what is right. Selah
content_old: 3 You love evil more than good, a lie more than speaking what is right. Selah

content: 4 You love all devouring words, O deceitful tongue,
content_old: 4 You love all devouring words, O deceitful tongue,

content: 5 but God will pull you down forever. He will snatch you and tear you away from your tent, and he will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah
content_old: 5 but God will pull you down forever. He will snatch you and tear you away from your tent, and he will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah

content: 6 And the righteous will see and fear, and will laugh at him, saying,
content_old: 6 And the righteous will see and fear, and will laugh at him, saying,

content: 7 “Look, the man who would not make God his refuge, but he trusted in the greatness of his wealth; he took refuge in his destructiveness.”
content_old: 7 “Look, the man who would not make God his refuge, but he trusted in the greatness of his wealth; he took refuge in his destructiveness.”

content: 8 But I am like an olive tree flourishing in the house of God. I trust the loyal love of God forever and ever.
content_old: 8 But I am like an olive tree flourishing in the house of God. I trust the loyal love of God forever and ever.

content: For the music director, according to Mahalath. A maskil of David.
content_old: For the music director, according to Mahalath. A maskil of David.

content: 1 The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt and they have done abominable iniquity. There is none who does good.
content_old: 1 The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt and they have done abominable iniquity. There is none who does good.

content: 2 God looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind to see whether there is one who has insight, one who seeks God.
content_old: 2 God looks down from heaven upon the children of humankind to see whether there is one who has insight, one who seeks God.

content: 3 All of them have turned back. They are altogether corrupt. There is none who does good; there is not even one.
content_old: 3 All of them have turned back. They are altogether corrupt. There is none who does good; there is not even one.

content: 4 Do not evildoers know, they who eat my people as though they were eating bread? They do not call on God.
content_old: 4 Do not evildoers know, they who eat my people as though they were eating bread? They do not call on God.

content: 5 There they are very fearful where no fear had been, because God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you. You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.
content_old: 5 There they are very fearful where no fear had been, because God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you. You have put them to shame, because God has rejected them.

content: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A maskil of David, when the Ziphites went and said to Saul, “Is not David hiding himself among us?”
content_old: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A maskil of David, when the Ziphites went and said to Saul, “Is not David hiding himself among us?”

content: 1 O God, by your name save me, and by your power vindicate me.
content_old: 1 O God, by your name save me, and by your power vindicate me.

content: 2 O God, hear my prayer; heed the words of my mouth.
content_old: 2 O God, hear my prayer; heed the words of my mouth.

content: 3 For foreigners have risen against me, and ruthless men seek my life. They have not set God before them. Selah
content_old: 3 For foreigners have risen against me, and ruthless men seek my life. They have not set God before them. Selah

content: 4 See, God is my helper; The Lord is with those who sustain my life.
content_old: 4 See, God is my helper; The Lord is with those who sustain my life.

content: 5 He will repay my enemies for their evil; in your faithfulness destroy them.
content_old: 5 He will repay my enemies for their evil; in your faithfulness destroy them.

content: 6 I will freely sacrifice to you; I will give thanks to your name, O Yahweh, because it is good.
content_old: 6 I will freely sacrifice to you; I will give thanks to your name, O Yahweh, because it is good.

content: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A maskil of David.
content_old: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A maskil of David.

content: 1 Give ear, O God, to my prayer, and do not hide yourself from my plea.
content_old: 1 Give ear, O God, to my prayer, and do not hide yourself from my plea.

content: 2 Attend to me and answer me. I am restless in my lamenting and I groan,
content_old: 2 Attend to me and answer me. I am restless in my lamenting and I groan,

content: 3 because of the voice of an enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked, because they bring down evil on me, and in anger they hold a grudge against me.
content_old: 3 because of the voice of an enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked, because they bring down evil on me, and in anger they hold a grudge against me.

content: 4 My heart trembles within me, and deathly terrors fall on me.
content_old: 4 My heart trembles within me, and deathly terrors fall on me.

content: 5 Fear and trembling come on me, and horror overwhelms me.
content_old: 5 Fear and trembling come on me, and horror overwhelms me.

content: 6 So I say, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove. I would fly away and be at rest.
content_old: 6 So I say, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove. I would fly away and be at rest.

content: 7 Look, I would flee far away. I would dwell in the wilderness. Selah
content_old: 7 Look, I would flee far away. I would dwell in the wilderness. Selah

content: 8 I would hurry to my refuge from the raging wind and storm.”
content_old: 8 I would hurry to my refuge from the raging wind and storm.”

content: 9 Confuse, O Lord; divide their speech, because I see violence and strife in the city.
content_old: 9 Confuse, O Lord; divide their speech, because I see violence and strife in the city.

content: 10 Day and night they go around it on its walls, and iniquity and trouble are in its midst.
content_old: 10 Day and night they go around it on its walls, and iniquity and trouble are in its midst.

content: 11 Destruction is within it, and oppression and deceit do not depart from its public square.
content_old: 11 Destruction is within it, and oppression and deceit do not depart from its public square.

content: 12 For it is not an enemy that taunts me, or I could bear it. It is not one who hates me that magnifies himself over me, or I could hide myself from him.
content_old: 12 For it is not an enemy that taunts me, or I could bear it. It is not one who hates me that magnifies himself over me, or I could hide myself from him.

content: 13 But it is you, a man my equal, my friend and confidant.
content_old: 13 But it is you, a man my equal, my friend and confidant.

content: 14 We who would take sweet counsel together; in the house of God we would walk with the throng.
content_old: 14 We who would take sweet counsel together; in the house of God we would walk with the throng.

content: 15 Let death deceive them. May they descend to Sheol alive, because evil is in their home and heart.
content_old: 15 Let death deceive them. May they descend to Sheol alive, because evil is in their home and heart.

content: 16 As for me, I will call to God, and Yahweh will save me.
content_old: 16 As for me, I will call to God, and Yahweh will save me.

content: 17 Morning, noon and night I will lament and groan loudly, and he will hear my voice.
content_old: 17 Morning, noon and night I will lament and groan loudly, and he will hear my voice.

content: 18 He safely redeems my life from the battle against me, because those standing against me are among many.
content_old: 18 He safely redeems my life from the battle against me, because those standing against me are among many.

content: 19 God will hear and answer them, he who is enthroned from of old, Selah Because they do not change, and they do not fear God.
content_old: 19 God will hear and answer them, he who is enthroned from of old, Selah Because they do not change, and they do not fear God.

content: 20 He has put forth his hands against his friends; he has defiled his covenant.
content_old: 20 He has put forth his hands against his friends; he has defiled his covenant.

content: 21 The buttery words of his mouth were smooth, but there was battle in his heart. His words were smoother than oil, but they were drawn swords.
content_old: 21 The buttery words of his mouth were smooth, but there was battle in his heart. His words were smoother than oil, but they were drawn swords.

content: 22 Cast your burden on Yahweh, and he will sustain you. He will never allow the righteous to be moved.
content_old: 22 Cast your burden on Yahweh, and he will sustain you. He will never allow the righteous to be moved.

content: For the music director, according to The Silent Dove of Distant Lands. Of David. A miktam. When the Philistines seized him in Gath.
content_old: For the music director, according to The Silent Dove of Distant Lands. Of David. A miktam. When the Philistines seized him in Gath.

content: 1 Be gracious to me, O God, because humankind has trampled me; fighting all the day he oppresses me.
content_old: 1 Be gracious to me, O God, because humankind has trampled me; fighting all the day he oppresses me.

content: 2 My enemies trample all day, because many are attacking me proudly.
content_old: 2 My enemies trample all day, because many are attacking me proudly.

content: 3 When I fear, I trust you.
content_old: 3 When I fear, I trust you.

content: 4 God, whose word I praise, God I trust; I do not fear. What can mere flesh do to me?
content_old: 4 God, whose word I praise, God I trust; I do not fear. What can mere flesh do to me?

content: 5 All day they twist my words; all their thoughts are against me for evil.
content_old: 5 All day they twist my words; all their thoughts are against me for evil.

content: 6 They attack, they hide, they watch my steps, as they lie in wait for my life.
content_old: 6 They attack, they hide, they watch my steps, as they lie in wait for my life.

content: 7 Because of iniquity will they escape? In anger cast down the peoples, O God.
content_old: 7 Because of iniquity will they escape? In anger cast down the peoples, O God.

content: 8 You have kept count of my wanderings. Put my tears in your bottle; are they not in your book?
content_old: 8 You have kept count of my wanderings. Put my tears in your bottle; are they not in your book?

content: 9 Then my enemies will turn back when I call. This I know because God is for me.
content_old: 9 Then my enemies will turn back when I call. This I know because God is for me.

content: 10 God, whose word I praise, Yahweh, whose word I praise,
content_old: 10 God, whose word I praise, Yahweh, whose word I praise,

content: 11 God I trust; I do not fear. What can mere humankind do to me?
content_old: 11 God I trust; I do not fear. What can mere humankind do to me?

content: 12 My vows to you, O God, are binding upon me. I will pay thank offerings to you,
content_old: 12 My vows to you, O God, are binding upon me. I will pay thank offerings to you,

content: For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy. Of David. A miktam. When he fled from Saul into the cave.
content_old: For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy. Of David. A miktam. When he fled from Saul into the cave.

content: 1 Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me, because in you my soul takes refuge. In the shadow of your wings I will take refuge until destruction passes by.
content_old: 1 Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me, because in you my soul takes refuge. In the shadow of your wings I will take refuge until destruction passes by.

content: 2 I will call to God Most High, to God who accomplishes things concerning me.
content_old: 2 I will call to God Most High, to God who accomplishes things concerning me.

content: 3 He will send from heaven and save me; he will reproach the one who tramples me. Selah God will send his loyal love and his faithfulness.
content_old: 3 He will send from heaven and save me; he will reproach the one who tramples me. Selah God will send his loyal love and his faithfulness.

content: 4 My soul is among lions. I lie down among those who devour— the children of humankind whose teeth are spears and arrows and whose tongues are sharp swords.
content_old: 4 My soul is among lions. I lie down among those who devour— the children of humankind whose teeth are spears and arrows and whose tongues are sharp swords.

content: 5 Be exalted above the heavens, O God. Let your glory be above all the earth.
content_old: 5 Be exalted above the heavens, O God. Let your glory be above all the earth.

content: 6 They have set a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down. They have dug a pit before me; they have fallen into the midst of it. Selah
content_old: 6 They have set a net for my steps; my soul is bowed down. They have dug a pit before me; they have fallen into the midst of it. Selah

content: 7 My heart is steadfast, O God; My heart is steadfast. I will sing and give praise.
content_old: 7 My heart is steadfast, O God; My heart is steadfast. I will sing and give praise.

content: 8 Awake, my glory; Awake, harp and lyre. I will awake the dawn.
content_old: 8 Awake, my glory; Awake, harp and lyre. I will awake the dawn.

content: 9 I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Lord; I will give you praise among the nations.
content_old: 9 I will give you thanks among the peoples, O Lord; I will give you praise among the nations.

content: 10 Because your loyal love is high to the heavens, and your faithfulness to the clouds.
content_old: 10 Because your loyal love is high to the heavens, and your faithfulness to the clouds.

content: For the music director, according to Do not Destroy. Of David. A miktam.
content_old: For the music director, according to Do not Destroy. Of David. A miktam.

content: 1 Do you really speak what is right when silent? Do you judge fairly the children of humankind?
content_old: 1 Do you really speak what is right when silent? Do you judge fairly the children of humankind?

content: 2 No, in your heart you plan injustices; in the land you weigh out the violence of your hands.
content_old: 2 No, in your heart you plan injustices; in the land you weigh out the violence of your hands.

content: 3 The wicked are estranged from the womb. They go astray from the belly, speaking lies.
content_old: 3 The wicked are estranged from the womb. They go astray from the belly, speaking lies.

content: 4 Their venom is like snake venom; They are like a deaf viper that closes its ear
content_old: 4 Their venom is like snake venom; They are like a deaf viper that closes its ear

content: 5 so that it does not hear the voice of charmers or the skilled caster of spells.
content_old: 5 so that it does not hear the voice of charmers or the skilled caster of spells.

content: 6 O God, break their teeth in their mouth. Break off the fangs of the young lions, O Yahweh.
content_old: 6 O God, break their teeth in their mouth. Break off the fangs of the young lions, O Yahweh.

content: 7 Let them run away like water that runs off. When he bends the bow, let his arrows be as though they were cut off.
content_old: 7 Let them run away like water that runs off. When he bends the bow, let his arrows be as though they were cut off.

content: 8 Let them be like a snail that melts away as it goes; like the stillborn of woman that do not see the sun.
content_old: 8 Let them be like a snail that melts away as it goes; like the stillborn of woman that do not see the sun.

content: 9 Before your pots can feel the heat of a thornbush, whether green or dry, he will sweep it away.
content_old: 9 Before your pots can feel the heat of a thornbush, whether green or dry, he will sweep it away.

content: 10 The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
content_old: 10 The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.

content: For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy. Of David. A miktam. When Saul dispatched men and they watched the house to kill him.
content_old: For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy. Of David. A miktam. When Saul dispatched men and they watched the house to kill him.

content: 1 Deliver me from my enemies, O my God. Protect me from those who rise up against me.
content_old: 1 Deliver me from my enemies, O my God. Protect me from those who rise up against me.

content: 2 Deliver me from workers of iniquity, and from men of bloodshed save me.
content_old: 2 Deliver me from workers of iniquity, and from men of bloodshed save me.

content: 3 For look, they lie in wait for my life. The mighty attack against me, not because of my transgression or my sin, O Yahweh.
content_old: 3 For look, they lie in wait for my life. The mighty attack against me, not because of my transgression or my sin, O Yahweh.

content: 4 Without guilt on my part they run and ready themselves. Awake to meet me and see.
content_old: 4 Without guilt on my part they run and ready themselves. Awake to meet me and see.

content: 5 And you, Yahweh, God of hosts, are the God of Israel. Rouse yourself to punish all the nations. Do not be gracious to any who treacherously plot evil. Selah
content_old: 5 And you, Yahweh, God of hosts, are the God of Israel. Rouse yourself to punish all the nations. Do not be gracious to any who treacherously plot evil. Selah

content: 6 They return at evening; they howl like dogs while they prowl the city.
content_old: 6 They return at evening; they howl like dogs while they prowl the city.

content: 7 Look, they pour out talk with their mouth. Swords are on their lips, for they say, “Who hears?”
content_old: 7 Look, they pour out talk with their mouth. Swords are on their lips, for they say, “Who hears?”

content: 8 But you, O Yahweh, will laugh at them; you will mock all the nations.
content_old: 8 But you, O Yahweh, will laugh at them; you will mock all the nations.

content: 9 O my strength, I will watch for you, because you, O God, are my high stronghold.
content_old: 9 O my strength, I will watch for you, because you, O God, are my high stronghold.

content: 10 My God of loyal love will meet me; God will cause me to look in triumph on my enemies.
content_old: 10 My God of loyal love will meet me; God will cause me to look in triumph on my enemies.

content: 11 Do not kill them, lest my people forget. Make them to wander by your power, and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
content_old: 11 Do not kill them, lest my people forget. Make them to wander by your power, and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.

content: 12 By the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips, even in their pride, let them be trapped, and for the curses and lies they proclaim.
content_old: 12 By the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips, even in their pride, let them be trapped, and for the curses and lies they proclaim.

content: 13 Destroy in anger; destroy so they are no more, so that they may know that God is ruling in Jacob to the ends of the earth. Selah
content_old: 13 Destroy in anger; destroy so they are no more, so that they may know that God is ruling in Jacob to the ends of the earth. Selah

content: 14 They return at evening; they howl like dogs while they prowl the city.
content_old: 14 They return at evening; they howl like dogs while they prowl the city.

content: 15 As for them, they wander for food. If they are not satisfied, then they continue all night.
content_old: 15 As for them, they wander for food. If they are not satisfied, then they continue all night.

content: 16 But as for me, I will sing of your strength, and I will hail your loyal love in the morning, because you have been my high stronghold and a refuge in my time of trouble.
content_old: 16 But as for me, I will sing of your strength, and I will hail your loyal love in the morning, because you have been my high stronghold and a refuge in my time of trouble.

content: For the music director, according to Shushan Eduth. A miktam of David. To teach. When he fought Mesopotamia and Aram Zobah, and Joab returned and struck Edom in the Valley of Salt, twelve thousand persons.
content_old: For the music director, according to Shushan Eduth. A miktam of David. To teach. When he fought Mesopotamia and Aram Zobah, and Joab returned and struck Edom in the Valley of Salt, twelve thousand persons.

content: 1 O God, you have rejected us. You have broken us. You have been angry. Restore us!
content_old: 1 O God, you have rejected us. You have broken us. You have been angry. Restore us!

content: 2 You have made the land quake. You have split it open. Heal its fissures, because it totters.
content_old: 2 You have made the land quake. You have split it open. Heal its fissures, because it totters.

content: 3 You have shown your people hard things; You have given us wine that staggers.
content_old: 3 You have shown your people hard things; You have given us wine that staggers.

content: 4 You have rallied those who fear you round a banner out of bowshot, Selah
content_old: 4 You have rallied those who fear you round a banner out of bowshot, Selah

content: 5 so that your beloved ones may be rescued. Save by your right hand and answer us.
content_old: 5 so that your beloved ones may be rescued. Save by your right hand and answer us.

content: 6 God has spoken in his holiness, “I will rejoice; I will divide up Shechem, and portion out the valley of Succoth.
content_old: 6 God has spoken in his holiness, “I will rejoice; I will divide up Shechem, and portion out the valley of Succoth.

content: 7 Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.
content_old: 7 Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine, and Ephraim is the helmet for my head; Judah is my scepter.

content: 8 Moab is my washing pot; over Edom, I will cast my sandal. On account of me, O Philistia, raise a shout.”
content_old: 8 Moab is my washing pot; over Edom, I will cast my sandal. On account of me, O Philistia, raise a shout.”

content: 9 Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
content_old: 9 Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

content: 10 Have not you yourself rejected us, O God, and not gone out with our armies, O God?
content_old: 10 Have not you yourself rejected us, O God, and not gone out with our armies, O God?

content: 11 Give us help against the adversary, for the help of humankind is futile.
content_old: 11 Give us help against the adversary, for the help of humankind is futile.

content: For the music director, upon stringed instruments. Of David.
content_old: For the music director, upon stringed instruments. Of David.

content: 1 Hear, O God, my cry; attend to my prayer.
content_old: 1 Hear, O God, my cry; attend to my prayer.

content: 2 From the end of the earth I call to you when my heart grows faint. You will lead me to a rock that is higher than I.
content_old: 2 From the end of the earth I call to you when my heart grows faint. You will lead me to a rock that is higher than I.

content: 3 For you have been my refuge, a strong tower from the enemy.
content_old: 3 For you have been my refuge, a strong tower from the enemy.

content: 4 Let me reside in your tent forever. Let me take refuge under the covering of your wings. Selah
content_old: 4 Let me reside in your tent forever. Let me take refuge under the covering of your wings. Selah

content: 5 For you, O God, you have heard my vows. You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.
content_old: 5 For you, O God, you have heard my vows. You have given me the heritage of those who fear your name.

content: 6 You will add days to the days of the king, his years like those of many generations.
content_old: 6 You will add days to the days of the king, his years like those of many generations.

content: 7 May he live forever in the presence of God. Appoint loyal love and faithfulness to preserve him.
content_old: 7 May he live forever in the presence of God. Appoint loyal love and faithfulness to preserve him.

content: For the music director, on Jeduthun. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director, on Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

content: 1 Only for God my soul waits in silence. From him is my salvation.
content_old: 1 Only for God my soul waits in silence. From him is my salvation.

content: 2 Only he is my rock and my salvation, my high stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.
content_old: 2 Only he is my rock and my salvation, my high stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.

content: 3 How long will you attack a man? All of you will be shattered like a leaning wall, a tottering fence.
content_old: 3 How long will you attack a man? All of you will be shattered like a leaning wall, a tottering fence.

content: 4 They only plan to thrust him down from his high position; they are pleased with deception. With their mouths they bless, but inwardly they curse. Selah
content_old: 4 They only plan to thrust him down from his high position; they are pleased with deception. With their mouths they bless, but inwardly they curse. Selah

content: 5 Only for God wait in silence, O my soul, because my hope is from him.
content_old: 5 Only for God wait in silence, O my soul, because my hope is from him.

content: 6 Only he is my rock and my salvation, my high stronghold; I shall not be shaken.
content_old: 6 Only he is my rock and my salvation, my high stronghold; I shall not be shaken.

content: 7 On God rests my salvation and my glory; God is my strong rock, my refuge.
content_old: 7 On God rests my salvation and my glory; God is my strong rock, my refuge.

content: 8 Trust him at all times, O people; pour out before him your heart. God is a refuge for us. Selah
content_old: 8 Trust him at all times, O people; pour out before him your heart. God is a refuge for us. Selah

content: 9 Only a vapor are men of low degree, a deception are men of high degree. Weighed in a balance, together they are lighter than a vapor.
content_old: 9 Only a vapor are men of low degree, a deception are men of high degree. Weighed in a balance, together they are lighter than a vapor.

content: 10 Do not trust in extortion, and do not put vain confidence in robbery. If wealth increases, do not set your heart on it.
content_old: 10 Do not trust in extortion, and do not put vain confidence in robbery. If wealth increases, do not set your heart on it.

content: 11 Once God has spoken; twice I have heard this: that strength belongs to God.
content_old: 11 Once God has spoken; twice I have heard this: that strength belongs to God.

content: A psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.
content_old: A psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.

content: 1 O God, you are my God; I will seek you diligently. My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you as in a dry and weary land without water.
content_old: 1 O God, you are my God; I will seek you diligently. My soul thirsts for you; my flesh longs for you as in a dry and weary land without water.

content: 2 Thus I have seen you in the sanctuary, beholding your strength and glory.
content_old: 2 Thus I have seen you in the sanctuary, beholding your strength and glory.

content: 3 Because your loyal love is better than life, my lips will praise you.
content_old: 3 Because your loyal love is better than life, my lips will praise you.

content: 4 So I will bless you while I live. I will lift up my hands in your name.
content_old: 4 So I will bless you while I live. I will lift up my hands in your name.

content: 5 My soul will be satisfied as with the best and richest food, and with joyful lips my mouth will praise.
content_old: 5 My soul will be satisfied as with the best and richest food, and with joyful lips my mouth will praise.

content: 6 When I remember you on my bed, I meditate on you in the night watches.
content_old: 6 When I remember you on my bed, I meditate on you in the night watches.

content: 7 Because you have been my help, therefore in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.
content_old: 7 Because you have been my help, therefore in the shadow of your wings I will sing for joy.

content: 8 My soul clings to you; your right hand upholds me.
content_old: 8 My soul clings to you; your right hand upholds me.

content: 9 But as for them who seek my life for ruin, they will go into the depths of the earth.
content_old: 9 But as for them who seek my life for ruin, they will go into the depths of the earth.

content: 10 They who would deliver him to the sword will become a portion for jackals.
content_old: 10 They who would deliver him to the sword will become a portion for jackals.

content: For the music director. A psalm of David.
content_old: For the music director. A psalm of David.

content: 1 Hear my voice, O God, in my lamenting. Preserve my life from the fear of the enemy.
content_old: 1 Hear my voice, O God, in my lamenting. Preserve my life from the fear of the enemy.

content: 2 Hide me from the secret plots of evildoers, from the unrest of those who do iniquity,
content_old: 2 Hide me from the secret plots of evildoers, from the unrest of those who do iniquity,

content: 3 who sharpen their tongue like a sword. They bend their bow to shoot their arrows—bitter words,
content_old: 3 who sharpen their tongue like a sword. They bend their bow to shoot their arrows—bitter words,

content: 4 to shoot from their hiding places at the blameless. Suddenly they shoot at him and do not fear.
content_old: 4 to shoot from their hiding places at the blameless. Suddenly they shoot at him and do not fear.

content: 5 They encourage themselves in the evil matter. They talk of secretly laying snares. They say, “Who will see them?”
content_old: 5 They encourage themselves in the evil matter. They talk of secretly laying snares. They say, “Who will see them?”

content: 6 They carefully plot injustices saying, “We have perfected the perfect plot!” Both the inner thought and heart of a man are deep.
content_old: 6 They carefully plot injustices saying, “We have perfected the perfect plot!” Both the inner thought and heart of a man are deep.

content: 7 But God will shoot them; with an arrow they will suddenly be wounded.
content_old: 7 But God will shoot them; with an arrow they will suddenly be wounded.

content: 8 And they who would cause him to stumble, their own tongue will be against them. All who gaze on them will shake.
content_old: 8 And they who would cause him to stumble, their own tongue will be against them. All who gaze on them will shake.

content: 9 And then all men will fear, and will declare the working of God, and will understand his doing.
content_old: 9 And then all men will fear, and will declare the working of God, and will understand his doing.

content: For the music director. A psalm of David. A song.
content_old: For the music director. A psalm of David. A song.

content: 1 Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion, and to you the vow shall be fulfilled.
content_old: 1 Praise awaits you, O God, in Zion, and to you the vow shall be fulfilled.

content: 2 O you who hear prayer, to you all flesh will come.
content_old: 2 O you who hear prayer, to you all flesh will come.

content: 3 Iniquities prevail over me. As for our transgressions, you will forgive them.
content_old: 3 Iniquities prevail over me. As for our transgressions, you will forgive them.

content: 4 Blessed is one whom you choose and bring near, that he may abide in your courts. We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house, your holy temple.
content_old: 4 Blessed is one whom you choose and bring near, that he may abide in your courts. We will be satisfied with the goodness of your house, your holy temple.

content: 5 By awesome deeds in righteousness you will answer us, O God of our salvation, you who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth and of the far-off seas,
content_old: 5 By awesome deeds in righteousness you will answer us, O God of our salvation, you who are the confidence of all the ends of the earth and of the far-off seas,

content: 6 who established the mountains by his strength, the one who is girded with might,
content_old: 6 who established the mountains by his strength, the one who is girded with might,

content: 7 who stills the roar of the seas, the roar of their waves, and the commotion of the peoples,
content_old: 7 who stills the roar of the seas, the roar of their waves, and the commotion of the peoples,

content: 8 so that the inhabitants of the farthest reaches are in awe of your signs. You make the dawn and sunset sing for joy.
content_old: 8 so that the inhabitants of the farthest reaches are in awe of your signs. You make the dawn and sunset sing for joy.

content: 9 You care for the land and water it; you greatly enrich it. The stream of God is filled with waters. You provide their grain, for so you have established it.
content_old: 9 You care for the land and water it; you greatly enrich it. The stream of God is filled with waters. You provide their grain, for so you have established it.

content: 10 You drench its furrows, penetrating its ridges. With rains you soften it; its growth you bless.
content_old: 10 You drench its furrows, penetrating its ridges. With rains you soften it; its growth you bless.

content: 11 You crown the year with your bounty, and your wagon paths drip with richness.
content_old: 11 You crown the year with your bounty, and your wagon paths drip with richness.

content: 12 They drop on the pastures of the wilderness, and the hills gird themselves with joy.
content_old: 12 They drop on the pastures of the wilderness, and the hills gird themselves with joy.

content: For the music director. A song. A psalm.
content_old: For the music director. A song. A psalm.

content: 1 Shout joyfully to God, all the earth.
content_old: 1 Shout joyfully to God, all the earth.

content: 2 Sing the glory of his name. Set forth his glorious praise.
content_old: 2 Sing the glory of his name. Set forth his glorious praise.

content: 3 Say to God, “How awesome are your works! Because of the greatness of your strength, your enemies will cringe before you.
content_old: 3 Say to God, “How awesome are your works! Because of the greatness of your strength, your enemies will cringe before you.

content: 4 All the earth will bow in worship to you, and sing praise to you. They will sing the praise of your name.” Selah
content_old: 4 All the earth will bow in worship to you, and sing praise to you. They will sing the praise of your name.” Selah

content: 5 Come and consider the works of God; he is awesome in his dealings with the children of humankind.
content_old: 5 Come and consider the works of God; he is awesome in his dealings with the children of humankind.

content: 6 He turned the sea into dry ground; they passed through the river on foot. There we rejoiced in him.
content_old: 6 He turned the sea into dry ground; they passed through the river on foot. There we rejoiced in him.

content: 7 He rules by his might forever; his eyes keep watch on the nations. Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah
content_old: 7 He rules by his might forever; his eyes keep watch on the nations. Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah

content: 8 Bless our God, O peoples, and cause the sound of his praise to be heard,
content_old: 8 Bless our God, O peoples, and cause the sound of his praise to be heard,

content: 9 the one who has kept our soul among the living, and has not allowed our foot to slip.
content_old: 9 the one who has kept our soul among the living, and has not allowed our foot to slip.

content: 10 For you have tested us, O God; you have tried us as silver is tried.
content_old: 10 For you have tested us, O God; you have tried us as silver is tried.

content: 11 You brought us into the net; you placed a heavy burden on our backs.
content_old: 11 You brought us into the net; you placed a heavy burden on our backs.

content: 12 You let men ride over our heads. We went through fire and through water, but you have brought us out to the place of abundance.
content_old: 12 You let men ride over our heads. We went through fire and through water, but you have brought us out to the place of abundance.

content: 13 I will come into your house with burnt offerings. I will pay to you my vows
content_old: 13 I will come into your house with burnt offerings. I will pay to you my vows

content: 14 that my lips uttered, and my mouth spoke in my distress.
content_old: 14 that my lips uttered, and my mouth spoke in my distress.

content: 15 Burnt offerings of fat animals I will offer to you, with the smoke of rams. I will do cattle with rams. Selah
content_old: 15 Burnt offerings of fat animals I will offer to you, with the smoke of rams. I will do cattle with rams. Selah

content: 16 Come and hear, all you God-fearers, and I will tell what he has done for me.
content_old: 16 Come and hear, all you God-fearers, and I will tell what he has done for me.

content: 17 I called to him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.
content_old: 17 I called to him with my mouth, and he was extolled with my tongue.

content: 18 If I had considered evil in my heart, the Lord would not have listened.
content_old: 18 If I had considered evil in my heart, the Lord would not have listened.

content: 19 However, God has listened; he has attended to the sound of my prayer.
content_old: 19 However, God has listened; he has attended to the sound of my prayer.

content: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A psalm. A song.
content_old: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A psalm. A song.

content: 1 May God be gracious to us and bless us. May he cause his face to shine toward us, Selah
content_old: 1 May God be gracious to us and bless us. May he cause his face to shine toward us, Selah

content: 2 that your way may be known on the earth, your salvation among all nations.
content_old: 2 that your way may be known on the earth, your salvation among all nations.

content: 3 Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all of the peoples praise you.
content_old: 3 Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all of the peoples praise you.

content: 4 Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, because you judge the peoples with equity and guide the nations on the earth. Selah
content_old: 4 Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, because you judge the peoples with equity and guide the nations on the earth. Selah

content: 5 Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.
content_old: 5 Let the peoples praise you, O God; let all the peoples praise you.

content: 6 The earth has yielded its produce. God, our God, will bless us.
content_old: 6 The earth has yielded its produce. God, our God, will bless us.

content: For the music director. Of David. A psalm. A song.
content_old: For the music director. Of David. A psalm. A song.

content: 1 God will arise; his enemies will be scattered, and those who hate him will flee from before him.
content_old: 1 God will arise; his enemies will be scattered, and those who hate him will flee from before him.

content: 2 As smoke is driven off, you will drive them off. As wax melts before fire, the wicked will perish before God.
content_old: 2 As smoke is driven off, you will drive them off. As wax melts before fire, the wicked will perish before God.

content: 3 But the righteous will be glad; they will exalt before God, and will rejoice with joy.
content_old: 3 But the righteous will be glad; they will exalt before God, and will rejoice with joy.

content: 4 Sing to God, sing praises to his name. Lift up a song to the rider on the clouds—his name is Yah— and rejoice before him.
content_old: 4 Sing to God, sing praises to his name. Lift up a song to the rider on the clouds—his name is Yah— and rejoice before him.

content: 5 A father to orphans and a judge for widows is God in his holy habitation.
content_old: 5 A father to orphans and a judge for widows is God in his holy habitation.

content: 6 God settles the lonely in a home; he brings prisoners out into prosperity. But the rebellious abide in a barren land.
content_old: 6 God settles the lonely in a home; he brings prisoners out into prosperity. But the rebellious abide in a barren land.

content: 7 O God, when you went out before your people, when you marched through the desert, Selah
content_old: 7 O God, when you went out before your people, when you marched through the desert, Selah

content: 8 the earth shook; the heavens also dripped rain at the presence of God who was at Sinai, at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
content_old: 8 the earth shook; the heavens also dripped rain at the presence of God who was at Sinai, at the presence of God, the God of Israel.

content: 9 You caused abundant rain to fall, O God. When your inheritance was weary you revived it.
content_old: 9 You caused abundant rain to fall, O God. When your inheritance was weary you revived it.

content: 10 Your community dwelled in it. You provided in your goodness for the poor, O God.
content_old: 10 Your community dwelled in it. You provided in your goodness for the poor, O God.

content: 11 The Lord gives the word. Great is the company of women who announce:
content_old: 11 The Lord gives the word. Great is the company of women who announce:

content: 12 “The kings of armies flee, they flee, and she who remains at home divides the spoil.
content_old: 12 “The kings of armies flee, they flee, and she who remains at home divides the spoil.

content: 13 Though you men lie down between the sheepfolds, you will be like the wings of a dove covered in silver and its pinions in yellow gold.”
content_old: 13 Though you men lie down between the sheepfolds, you will be like the wings of a dove covered in silver and its pinions in yellow gold.”

content: 14 When Shaddai scattered kings on it, on Zalmon it snowed.
content_old: 14 When Shaddai scattered kings on it, on Zalmon it snowed.

content: 15 A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; a mountain of many peaks is the mountain of Bashan.
content_old: 15 A mountain of God is the mountain of Bashan; a mountain of many peaks is the mountain of Bashan.

content: 16 Why do you look with hostility, O many-peaked mountains? This mountain God desires for his dwelling. Yes, Yahweh will abide in it forever.
content_old: 16 Why do you look with hostility, O many-peaked mountains? This mountain God desires for his dwelling. Yes, Yahweh will abide in it forever.

content: 17 The chariots of God are twice ten thousand, with thousands doubled. The Lord is among them at Sinai, distinctive in victory.
content_old: 17 The chariots of God are twice ten thousand, with thousands doubled. The Lord is among them at Sinai, distinctive in victory.

content: 18 You have ascended on high; you have led away captives. You have received gifts from among humankind, and even from the rebellious, so that Yah God may dwell there.
content_old: 18 You have ascended on high; you have led away captives. You have received gifts from among humankind, and even from the rebellious, so that Yah God may dwell there.

content: 19 Blessed be the Lord. Daily he loads us with benefits, the God of our salvation. Selah
content_old: 19 Blessed be the Lord. Daily he loads us with benefits, the God of our salvation. Selah

content: 20 Our God is a God of deliverances, and to the Yahweh the Lord belong escapes from death.
content_old: 20 Our God is a God of deliverances, and to the Yahweh the Lord belong escapes from death.

content: 21 But God will shatter the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of the one who continues on in his guilt.
content_old: 21 But God will shatter the head of his enemies, the hairy scalp of the one who continues on in his guilt.

content: 22 The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,
content_old: 22 The Lord said, “I will bring them back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea,

content: 23 so that your foot may shatter them bloody for the tongues of your dogs to have their share from the enemies.”
content_old: 23 so that your foot may shatter them bloody for the tongues of your dogs to have their share from the enemies.”

content: 24 They have seen your processions, O God, the processions of my God, my king, distinctive in victory.
content_old: 24 They have seen your processions, O God, the processions of my God, my king, distinctive in victory.

content: 25 Singers went up front, those playing stringed instruments last, between them young women playing tambourines.
content_old: 25 Singers went up front, those playing stringed instruments last, between them young women playing tambourines.

content: 26 Bless God in the assemblies, Yahweh from the fountain of Israel.
content_old: 26 Bless God in the assemblies, Yahweh from the fountain of Israel.

content: 27 There is little Benjamin ruling them, with the princes of Judah in their throng, the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.
content_old: 27 There is little Benjamin ruling them, with the princes of Judah in their throng, the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.

content: 28 Your God has commanded your strength. Show yourself strong, O God, by what you perform for us.
content_old: 28 Your God has commanded your strength. Show yourself strong, O God, by what you perform for us.

content: 29 Because your temple is above Jerusalem, kings will bring tribute to you.
content_old: 29 Because your temple is above Jerusalem, kings will bring tribute to you.

content: 30 Rebuke the beasts in the reeds, the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples, trampling the pieces of silver. Scatter the nations who delight in battles.
content_old: 30 Rebuke the beasts in the reeds, the herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples, trampling the pieces of silver. Scatter the nations who delight in battles.

content: 31 Ambassadors will come from Egypt; Cush will quickly stretch out her hands to God.
content_old: 31 Ambassadors will come from Egypt; Cush will quickly stretch out her hands to God.

content: 32 O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; sing praise to the Lord, Selah
content_old: 32 O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; sing praise to the Lord, Selah

content: 33 to the one who rides in the highest heavens of old. See, he gives forth his voice, a mighty voice.
content_old: 33 to the one who rides in the highest heavens of old. See, he gives forth his voice, a mighty voice.

content: 34 Ascribe strength to God. His majesty is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
content_old: 34 Ascribe strength to God. His majesty is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.

content: For the music director, according to The Lilies. Of David.
content_old: For the music director, according to The Lilies. Of David.

content: 1 Save me, O God, because waters have come up to my neck.
content_old: 1 Save me, O God, because waters have come up to my neck.

content: 2 I sink in the mud of the deep, and there is no foothold. I have come to watery depths, and the torrent floods over me.
content_old: 2 I sink in the mud of the deep, and there is no foothold. I have come to watery depths, and the torrent floods over me.

content: 3 I am weary with my calling out; my throat is parched. My eyes are exhausted in my waiting for my God.
content_old: 3 I am weary with my calling out; my throat is parched. My eyes are exhausted in my waiting for my God.

content: 4 More numerous than the hairs of my head are those hating me without a cause. Those who are destroying me—my enemies wrongfully— are mighty. What I did not steal, I then must restore.
content_old: 4 More numerous than the hairs of my head are those hating me without a cause. Those who are destroying me—my enemies wrongfully— are mighty. What I did not steal, I then must restore.

content: 5 O God, you yourself know my foolishness, and my guilty deeds are not hidden from you.
content_old: 5 O God, you yourself know my foolishness, and my guilty deeds are not hidden from you.

content: 6 Let those who wait for you not be put to shame because of me, O Lord Yahweh of hosts. Let those who seek you not be disgraced because of me, O God of Israel.
content_old: 6 Let those who wait for you not be put to shame because of me, O Lord Yahweh of hosts. Let those who seek you not be disgraced because of me, O God of Israel.

content: 7 Because on account of you I have borne reproach; disgrace has covered my face.
content_old: 7 Because on account of you I have borne reproach; disgrace has covered my face.

content: 8 I have become a stranger to my brothers and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,
content_old: 8 I have become a stranger to my brothers and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,

content: 9 because the zeal for your house has consumed me, and the reproaches of those reproaching you have fallen on me.
content_old: 9 because the zeal for your house has consumed me, and the reproaches of those reproaching you have fallen on me.

content: 10 When I wept in the fasting of my soul, it became reproaches for me.
content_old: 10 When I wept in the fasting of my soul, it became reproaches for me.

content: 11 When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became for them a byword.
content_old: 11 When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became for them a byword.

content: 12 Those sitting at the gate talk about me as also the songs of the drunkards.
content_old: 12 Those sitting at the gate talk about me as also the songs of the drunkards.

content: 13 But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Yahweh, for a favorable time, O God, according to the abundance of your loyal love. Answer me with the faithfulness of your salvation.
content_old: 13 But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Yahweh, for a favorable time, O God, according to the abundance of your loyal love. Answer me with the faithfulness of your salvation.

content: 14 Deliver me from the mud and do not let me sink. Let me be delivered from those who hate me and from the watery depths.
content_old: 14 Deliver me from the mud and do not let me sink. Let me be delivered from those who hate me and from the watery depths.

content: 15 Do not let the torrent of waters flood over me, or the deep swallow me, or the pit close its mouth over me.
content_old: 15 Do not let the torrent of waters flood over me, or the deep swallow me, or the pit close its mouth over me.

content: 16 Answer me, O Yahweh, because your loyal love is good; according to your abundant mercies, turn to me,
content_old: 16 Answer me, O Yahweh, because your loyal love is good; according to your abundant mercies, turn to me,

content: 17 and do not hide your face from your servant. Because I am in trouble, answer me quickly.
content_old: 17 and do not hide your face from your servant. Because I am in trouble, answer me quickly.

content: 18 Draw near to my soul; redeem it. Because of my enemies, ransom me.
content_old: 18 Draw near to my soul; redeem it. Because of my enemies, ransom me.

content: 19 You know my reproach, my shame and my disgrace. Fully known to you are all my adversaries.
content_old: 19 You know my reproach, my shame and my disgrace. Fully known to you are all my adversaries.

content: 20 Reproach has broken my heart and I am sick. And I hoped for sympathy, but there was none, and for comforters, but I found none.
content_old: 20 Reproach has broken my heart and I am sick. And I hoped for sympathy, but there was none, and for comforters, but I found none.

content: 21 They also gave me gall for food, and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
content_old: 21 They also gave me gall for food, and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

content: 22 Let their table before them be a trap, and their times of peace a snare.
content_old: 22 Let their table before them be a trap, and their times of peace a snare.

content: 23 Let their eyes be dark so they cannot see, and make their loins continually tremble.
content_old: 23 Let their eyes be dark so they cannot see, and make their loins continually tremble.

content: 24 Pour out your indignation on them, and let your burning anger overtake them.
content_old: 24 Pour out your indignation on them, and let your burning anger overtake them.

content: 25 Let their camp be desolate. Let none dwell in their tents,
content_old: 25 Let their camp be desolate. Let none dwell in their tents,

content: 26 because they persecute those whom you, yourself, have struck, and they tell of the pain of those you have wounded.
content_old: 26 because they persecute those whom you, yourself, have struck, and they tell of the pain of those you have wounded.

content: 27 Add guilt on top of their guilt, and do not let them be acquitted.
content_old: 27 Add guilt on top of their guilt, and do not let them be acquitted.

content: 28 Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and let them not be recorded with the righteous.
content_old: 28 Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and let them not be recorded with the righteous.

content: 29 But as for me, though I am afflicted and pained, your salvation will protect me, O God.
content_old: 29 But as for me, though I am afflicted and pained, your salvation will protect me, O God.

content: 30 I will praise the name of God in song, and magnify him with thanksgiving.
content_old: 30 I will praise the name of God in song, and magnify him with thanksgiving.

content: 31 For Yahweh it will be better than an ox or bull, horned and hoofed.
content_old: 31 For Yahweh it will be better than an ox or bull, horned and hoofed.

content: 32 The afflicted will see and rejoice. O God seekers, let your heart revive,
content_old: 32 The afflicted will see and rejoice. O God seekers, let your heart revive,

content: 33 because Yahweh hears the needy and does not despise his own who are prisoners.
content_old: 33 because Yahweh hears the needy and does not despise his own who are prisoners.

content: 34 Let heavens and earth praise him, the seas and all that moves in them,
content_old: 34 Let heavens and earth praise him, the seas and all that moves in them,

content: 35 because God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah, that they may dwell there and possess it.
content_old: 35 because God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah, that they may dwell there and possess it.

content: For the music director. Of David. To bring to remembrance.
content_old: For the music director. Of David. To bring to remembrance.

content: 1 O God, make haste to deliver me. O Yahweh, make haste to help me.
content_old: 1 O God, make haste to deliver me. O Yahweh, make haste to help me.

content: 2 Let them be ashamed and abashed who seek my life. Let them be repulsed and humiliated who desire my harm.
content_old: 2 Let them be ashamed and abashed who seek my life. Let them be repulsed and humiliated who desire my harm.

content: 3 let them turn back because of their shame, those who say, “Aha! Aha!”
content_old: 3 let them turn back because of their shame, those who say, “Aha! Aha!”

content: 4 Let them rejoice and be glad in you, all those who seek you. Let them say continually, “God is great!” those who love your salvation.
content_old: 4 Let them rejoice and be glad in you, all those who seek you. Let them say continually, “God is great!” those who love your salvation.

content: 1 In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame.
content_old: 1 In you, O Yahweh, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame.

content: 2 In your righteousness deliver me and rescue me; incline your ear to me and save me.
content_old: 2 In your righteousness deliver me and rescue me; incline your ear to me and save me.

content: 3 Be for me a rock of refuge to resort to always; you have ordained to save me, because you are my rock and my fortress.
content_old: 3 Be for me a rock of refuge to resort to always; you have ordained to save me, because you are my rock and my fortress.

content: 4 My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the evildoer and the oppressor,
content_old: 4 My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the evildoer and the oppressor,

content: 5 because you are my hope, O Lord Yahweh, my confidence from my youth.
content_old: 5 because you are my hope, O Lord Yahweh, my confidence from my youth.

content: 6 Upon you I have leaned from birth. It was you who took me from the womb of my mother. My praise is of you continually.
content_old: 6 Upon you I have leaned from birth. It was you who took me from the womb of my mother. My praise is of you continually.

content: 7 I have become a wonder to many, but you are my strong refuge.
content_old: 7 I have become a wonder to many, but you are my strong refuge.

content: 8 My mouth is filled with your praise, with your glory all the day.
content_old: 8 My mouth is filled with your praise, with your glory all the day.

content: 9 Do not cast me away in the time of old age; when my strength fails do not abandon me.
content_old: 9 Do not cast me away in the time of old age; when my strength fails do not abandon me.

content: 10 For my enemies talk concerning me, and those who watch for my life conspire together,
content_old: 10 For my enemies talk concerning me, and those who watch for my life conspire together,

content: 11 saying, “His God has abandoned him. Pursue and seize him, because there is no deliverer.”
content_old: 11 saying, “His God has abandoned him. Pursue and seize him, because there is no deliverer.”

content: 12 O God, do not be far from me. My God, hurry to help me.
content_old: 12 O God, do not be far from me. My God, hurry to help me.

content: 13 Let them be ashamed; let them perish who are my adversaries. Let them wrap themselves with scorn and disgrace who seek my harm.
content_old: 13 Let them be ashamed; let them perish who are my adversaries. Let them wrap themselves with scorn and disgrace who seek my harm.

content: 14 But as for me, I will hope continually and increase your praise.
content_old: 14 But as for me, I will hope continually and increase your praise.

content: 15 My mouth will tell of your righteousness, your salvation all day long, though I do not know the full sum of them.
content_old: 15 My mouth will tell of your righteousness, your salvation all day long, though I do not know the full sum of them.

content: 16 I will come in to tell the mighty deeds of Lord Yahweh. I will make known your righteousness, yours only.
content_old: 16 I will come in to tell the mighty deeds of Lord Yahweh. I will make known your righteousness, yours only.

content: 17 O God, you have taught me from my youth, and up to now I have proclaimed your wonderful deeds.
content_old: 17 O God, you have taught me from my youth, and up to now I have proclaimed your wonderful deeds.

content: 18 And even when I am old and gray, O God, do not abandon me until I proclaim your strength to this generation, your power to every one that comes after.
content_old: 18 And even when I am old and gray, O God, do not abandon me until I proclaim your strength to this generation, your power to every one that comes after.

content: 19 And your righteousness, O God, is to the height of heaven. You who have done great things, O God, who is like you?
content_old: 19 And your righteousness, O God, is to the height of heaven. You who have done great things, O God, who is like you?

content: 20 You who have caused me to see many troubles and evils, you will again revive me. And from the depths of the earth you will again bring me up.
content_old: 20 You who have caused me to see many troubles and evils, you will again revive me. And from the depths of the earth you will again bring me up.

content: 21 You will increase my greatness, and you will comfort me all around.
content_old: 21 You will increase my greatness, and you will comfort me all around.

content: 22 On my part, I will praise you with a stringed instrument, and your faithfulness, O my God. I will sing praises to you with a lyre, O Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 22 On my part, I will praise you with a stringed instrument, and your faithfulness, O my God. I will sing praises to you with a lyre, O Holy One of Israel.

content: 23 My lips will sing for joy when I sing praises to you, and my soul, which you have redeemed.
content_old: 23 My lips will sing for joy when I sing praises to you, and my soul, which you have redeemed.

content: Of Solomon.
content_old: Of Solomon.

content: 1 O God, give your judgments to the king, and your righteousness to the king’s son.
content_old: 1 O God, give your judgments to the king, and your righteousness to the king’s son.

content: 2 May he judge your people with righteousness, and your poor with justice.
content_old: 2 May he judge your people with righteousness, and your poor with justice.

content: 3 Let the mountains yield prosperity for the people, and the hills in righteousness.
content_old: 3 Let the mountains yield prosperity for the people, and the hills in righteousness.

content: 4 May he provide justice for the poor of the people, save the children of the needy, and crush the oppressor.
content_old: 4 May he provide justice for the poor of the people, save the children of the needy, and crush the oppressor.

content: 5 May he live long while the sun endures as long as the moon for all generations.
content_old: 5 May he live long while the sun endures as long as the moon for all generations.

content: 6 May he descend like rain on mown grass, like showers watering the earth.
content_old: 6 May he descend like rain on mown grass, like showers watering the earth.

content: 7 May what is right blossom in his days and an abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.
content_old: 7 May what is right blossom in his days and an abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.

content: 8 And may he rule from sea up to sea, and from the River to the edges of the land.
content_old: 8 And may he rule from sea up to sea, and from the River to the edges of the land.

content: 9 Let the desert dwellers bow down before him, and his enemies lick the dust.
content_old: 9 Let the desert dwellers bow down before him, and his enemies lick the dust.

content: 10 Let the kings of Tarshish and the islands bring tribute. Let the kings of Sheba and Seba present gifts,
content_old: 10 Let the kings of Tarshish and the islands bring tribute. Let the kings of Sheba and Seba present gifts,

content: 11 and let all kings bow down to him. Let all nations serve him.
content_old: 11 and let all kings bow down to him. Let all nations serve him.

content: 12 Indeed he will deliver the needy who is crying for help, and the afflicted who has no helper.
content_old: 12 Indeed he will deliver the needy who is crying for help, and the afflicted who has no helper.

content: 13 He will take pity on the helpless and needy, and the lives of the needy he will save.
content_old: 13 He will take pity on the helpless and needy, and the lives of the needy he will save.

content: 14 From oppression and from violence he will redeem their lives, and their blood will be precious in his eyes.
content_old: 14 From oppression and from violence he will redeem their lives, and their blood will be precious in his eyes.

content: 15 So may he live, and may gold from Sheba be given to him, and may prayers be offered for him continually. May blessings be invoked for him all day long.
content_old: 15 So may he live, and may gold from Sheba be given to him, and may prayers be offered for him continually. May blessings be invoked for him all day long.

content: 16 May there be an abundance of grain in the land even on the top of the mountains. May his crop sway like the trees of Lebanon, and may those from the city blossom like the grass of the earth.
content_old: 16 May there be an abundance of grain in the land even on the top of the mountains. May his crop sway like the trees of Lebanon, and may those from the city blossom like the grass of the earth.

content: 17 May his name endure forever. May his name increase as long as the sun shines, and let them be blessed in him. Let all nations call him blessed.
content_old: 17 May his name endure forever. May his name increase as long as the sun shines, and let them be blessed in him. Let all nations call him blessed.

content: 18 Blessed be Yahweh God, the God of Israel, who alone does wonderful things.
content_old: 18 Blessed be Yahweh God, the God of Israel, who alone does wonderful things.

content: 19 And blessed be his glorious name forever, and may the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen and Amen.
content_old: 19 And blessed be his glorious name forever, and may the whole earth be filled with his glory. Amen and Amen.

content: A song of Asaph.
content_old: A song of Asaph.

content: 1 Surely God is good to Israel, to those pure of heart.
content_old: 1 Surely God is good to Israel, to those pure of heart.

content: 2 But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled. My steps had nearly slipped,
content_old: 2 But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled. My steps had nearly slipped,

content: 3 because I envied the boastful when I saw the well-being of the wicked.
content_old: 3 because I envied the boastful when I saw the well-being of the wicked.

content: 4 For there are no pains up to their death, and their bodies are healthy.
content_old: 4 For there are no pains up to their death, and their bodies are healthy.

content: 5 They do not have ordinary trouble, and they are not plagued as other people.
content_old: 5 They do not have ordinary trouble, and they are not plagued as other people.

content: 6 Therefore pride is their necklace; an outfit of violence covers them.
content_old: 6 Therefore pride is their necklace; an outfit of violence covers them.

content: 7 Their eye bulges from fat. Imaginings overflow their heart.
content_old: 7 Their eye bulges from fat. Imaginings overflow their heart.

content: 8 They mock and speak maliciously of oppression; they speak as though from on high.
content_old: 8 They mock and speak maliciously of oppression; they speak as though from on high.

content: 9 They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue roams the earth.
content_old: 9 They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue roams the earth.

content: 10 Therefore his people turn there, and abundant waters are slurped up by them.
content_old: 10 Therefore his people turn there, and abundant waters are slurped up by them.

content: 11 And they say, “How does God know?” and, “Does the Most High have knowledge?”
content_old: 11 And they say, “How does God know?” and, “Does the Most High have knowledge?”

content: 12 See, these are the wicked, and they increase wealth, ever carefree.
content_old: 12 See, these are the wicked, and they increase wealth, ever carefree.

content: 13 Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure, and washed my hands in innocence.
content_old: 13 Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure, and washed my hands in innocence.

content: 14 And I have been plagued all day and rebuked every morning.
content_old: 14 And I have been plagued all day and rebuked every morning.

content: 15 If I had said, “I will speak thus,” behold, I would have acted treacherously against your children’s generation.
content_old: 15 If I had said, “I will speak thus,” behold, I would have acted treacherously against your children’s generation.

content: 16 When I thought about how to understand this, it was troubling in my eyes
content_old: 16 When I thought about how to understand this, it was troubling in my eyes

content: 17 until I went into the sanctuary of God. Then I understood their fate.
content_old: 17 until I went into the sanctuary of God. Then I understood their fate.

content: 18 Surely you set them on slippery places. You cause them to fall onto ruin.
content_old: 18 Surely you set them on slippery places. You cause them to fall onto ruin.

content: 19 How they become a desolation in a moment! They come to a complete end by terrors.
content_old: 19 How they become a desolation in a moment! They come to a complete end by terrors.

content: 20 Like a dream upon awakening, when you wake up, O Lord, you will despise their fleeting form.
content_old: 20 Like a dream upon awakening, when you wake up, O Lord, you will despise their fleeting form.

content: 21 When my heart was embittered and I felt stabbed in my kidneys,
content_old: 21 When my heart was embittered and I felt stabbed in my kidneys,

content: 22 then I was brutish and ignorant. With you I was like the beasts.
content_old: 22 then I was brutish and ignorant. With you I was like the beasts.

content: 23 But I am continually with you; you have hold of my right hand.
content_old: 23 But I am continually with you; you have hold of my right hand.

content: 24 You will guide me with your advice, and afterward you will take me into honor.
content_old: 24 You will guide me with your advice, and afterward you will take me into honor.

content: 25 Whom do I have in the heavens except you? And with you I have no other desire on earth.
content_old: 25 Whom do I have in the heavens except you? And with you I have no other desire on earth.

content: 26 My flesh and heart failed, but God is the strength of my heart and my reward forever.
content_old: 26 My flesh and heart failed, but God is the strength of my heart and my reward forever.

content: 27 For indeed, those distancing themselves from you will be ruined. You destroy each who abandons you for harlotry.
content_old: 27 For indeed, those distancing themselves from you will be ruined. You destroy each who abandons you for harlotry.

content: A maskil of Asaph.
content_old: A maskil of Asaph.

content: 1 Why, O God, have you rejected us forever? Why does your anger smoke against the sheep of your pasture?
content_old: 1 Why, O God, have you rejected us forever? Why does your anger smoke against the sheep of your pasture?

content: 2 Remember your congregation that you bought long ago, when you redeemed the tribe of your inheritance. Remember Mount Zion where you have dwelt.
content_old: 2 Remember your congregation that you bought long ago, when you redeemed the tribe of your inheritance. Remember Mount Zion where you have dwelt.

content: 3 Lift your steps to the perpetual ruins, to all that the enemy has ruined in the sanctuary.
content_old: 3 Lift your steps to the perpetual ruins, to all that the enemy has ruined in the sanctuary.

content: 4 Your enemies have roared in the midst of your meeting place; they have set up their signs for signs.
content_old: 4 Your enemies have roared in the midst of your meeting place; they have set up their signs for signs.

content: 5 They are known to be like those who wield axes in a thicket of trees.
content_old: 5 They are known to be like those who wield axes in a thicket of trees.

content: 6 And now its carved works altogether they have smashed with axe and hammer.
content_old: 6 And now its carved works altogether they have smashed with axe and hammer.

content: 7 They have set fire to your sanctuary. They have defiled to the ground, the dwelling place for your name.
content_old: 7 They have set fire to your sanctuary. They have defiled to the ground, the dwelling place for your name.

content: 8 They have said in their heart, “We will completely oppress them.” They burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
content_old: 8 They have said in their heart, “We will completely oppress them.” They burned all the meeting places of God in the land.

content: 9 We do not see our signs, and there is no longer a prophet. No one with us knows how long.
content_old: 9 We do not see our signs, and there is no longer a prophet. No one with us knows how long.

content: 10 How long, O God, will the adversary taunt? Will the enemy treat your name with contempt forever?
content_old: 10 How long, O God, will the adversary taunt? Will the enemy treat your name with contempt forever?

content: 11 Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand? Take it from your bosom; destroy them!
content_old: 11 Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand? Take it from your bosom; destroy them!

content: 12 But God has been my king from long ago, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
content_old: 12 But God has been my king from long ago, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

content: 13 You split open the sea by your strength; You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
content_old: 13 You split open the sea by your strength; You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.

content: 14 You crushed the heads of Leviathan; you gave him as food to the desert dwelling creatures.
content_old: 14 You crushed the heads of Leviathan; you gave him as food to the desert dwelling creatures.

content: 15 You split open spring and wadi. You dried up ever-flowing rivers.
content_old: 15 You split open spring and wadi. You dried up ever-flowing rivers.

content: 16 Yours is the day, yours is the night also. You established light and the sun.
content_old: 16 Yours is the day, yours is the night also. You established light and the sun.

content: 17 You defined all the boundaries of the earth; Summer and winter—you formed them.
content_old: 17 You defined all the boundaries of the earth; Summer and winter—you formed them.

content: 18 O Yahweh, remember this: the enemy taunts, and foolish people treat your name with contempt.
content_old: 18 O Yahweh, remember this: the enemy taunts, and foolish people treat your name with contempt.

content: 19 Do not give to beasts the life of your dove; do not ever forget the life of your afflicted ones.
content_old: 19 Do not give to beasts the life of your dove; do not ever forget the life of your afflicted ones.

content: 20 Have regard for the covenant, because the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of violence.
content_old: 20 Have regard for the covenant, because the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of violence.

content: 21 Do not let the oppressed turn back humiliated; let the poor and needy praise your name.
content_old: 21 Do not let the oppressed turn back humiliated; let the poor and needy praise your name.

content: 22 Rise up, O God, plead your cause; remember the reproaching of you by the foolish all day long.
content_old: 22 Rise up, O God, plead your cause; remember the reproaching of you by the foolish all day long.

content: For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy. A psalm of Asaph. A song.
content_old: For the music director, according to Do Not Destroy. A psalm of Asaph. A song.

content: 1 We give thanks to you, O God; we give thanks, and your name is near. Your wonderful deeds are told.
content_old: 1 We give thanks to you, O God; we give thanks, and your name is near. Your wonderful deeds are told.

content: 2 “I will indeed set an appointed time; I will judge fairly.
content_old: 2 “I will indeed set an appointed time; I will judge fairly.

content: 3 The earth and all its inhabitants are shaking; I steady its columns. Selah
content_old: 3 The earth and all its inhabitants are shaking; I steady its columns. Selah

content: 4 I say to the boastful, ‘Do not boast!’ and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horn!
content_old: 4 I say to the boastful, ‘Do not boast!’ and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horn!

content: 5 Do not lift up high your horn. Do not speak with arrogant pride.’ ”
content_old: 5 Do not lift up high your horn. Do not speak with arrogant pride.’ ”

content: 6 For it is not from the east or the west and not from the south that lifting up comes,
content_old: 6 For it is not from the east or the west and not from the south that lifting up comes,

content: 7 rather God is the judge; one he brings low, and another he lifts up.
content_old: 7 rather God is the judge; one he brings low, and another he lifts up.

content: 8 For there is a cup in the hand of Yahweh with wine that foams, fully mixed, and he pours out from this. Surely all the wicked of the land will quaff it down to its dregs.
content_old: 8 For there is a cup in the hand of Yahweh with wine that foams, fully mixed, and he pours out from this. Surely all the wicked of the land will quaff it down to its dregs.

content: 9 But as for me, I will proclaim forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
content_old: 9 But as for me, I will proclaim forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.

content: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song.
content_old: For the music director, with stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song.

content: 1 God is known in Judah. His name is great in Israel.
content_old: 1 God is known in Judah. His name is great in Israel.

content: 2 His den has been in Salem, his lair in Zion.
content_old: 2 His den has been in Salem, his lair in Zion.

content: 3 There he broke the flames of the bow, the shield and sword and battle. Selah
content_old: 3 There he broke the flames of the bow, the shield and sword and battle. Selah

content: 4 Radiant you are, majestic, from the mountains of prey.
content_old: 4 Radiant you are, majestic, from the mountains of prey.

content: 5 The stouthearted are plundered; they sleep their sleep, and all the able men cannot use their hands.
content_old: 5 The stouthearted are plundered; they sleep their sleep, and all the able men cannot use their hands.

content: 6 At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both rider and horse slumber.
content_old: 6 At your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both rider and horse slumber.

content: 7 You, indeed, are to be feared, and who can stand before you when you are angry?
content_old: 7 You, indeed, are to be feared, and who can stand before you when you are angry?

content: 8 From heaven you proclaimed judgment. The earth feared and was still
content_old: 8 From heaven you proclaimed judgment. The earth feared and was still

content: 9 when God rose for justice, to save all the afflicted of the land. Selah
content_old: 9 when God rose for justice, to save all the afflicted of the land. Selah

content: 10 For the anger of humankind will praise you. You will put on the remnant of anger.
content_old: 10 For the anger of humankind will praise you. You will put on the remnant of anger.

content: 11 Make vows and fulfill them to Yahweh, your God; let all surrounding him bring tribute to the one to be feared.
content_old: 11 Make vows and fulfill them to Yahweh, your God; let all surrounding him bring tribute to the one to be feared.

content: For the music director, on Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.
