content_old: For the music director, on Jeduthun. Of Asaph. A psalm.

content: 1 I cry out with my voice to God; with my voice to God, that he may hear me.
content_old: 1 I cry out with my voice to God; with my voice to God, that he may hear me.

content: 2 In the day I have trouble, I seek the Lord. At night my hand stretches out continually; my soul refuses to be comforted.
content_old: 2 In the day I have trouble, I seek the Lord. At night my hand stretches out continually; my soul refuses to be comforted.

content: 3 I remember God and I groan loudly; I meditate and my spirit grows faint. Selah
content_old: 3 I remember God and I groan loudly; I meditate and my spirit grows faint. Selah

content: 4 You hold open my eyelids. I am troubled and cannot speak.
content_old: 4 You hold open my eyelids. I am troubled and cannot speak.

content: 5 I think about the days from long ago, the years of ancient times.
content_old: 5 I think about the days from long ago, the years of ancient times.

content: 6 I remember my song in the night. With my heart I meditate, and my spirit searches to understand.
content_old: 6 I remember my song in the night. With my heart I meditate, and my spirit searches to understand.

content: 7 Will the Lord reject us forever, and will he never be pleased with us again?
content_old: 7 Will the Lord reject us forever, and will he never be pleased with us again?

content: 8 Has his loyal love ceased forever? Is his promise ended throughout generations?
content_old: 8 Has his loyal love ceased forever? Is his promise ended throughout generations?

content: 9 Has God forgotten to have compassion? Or has he closed off his mercies in anger? Selah
content_old: 9 Has God forgotten to have compassion? Or has he closed off his mercies in anger? Selah

content: 10 So I said, “This pierces me— the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
content_old: 10 So I said, “This pierces me— the right hand of the Most High has changed.”

content: 11 I will remember the deeds of Yah. Surely I will remember your wonders from long ago.
content_old: 11 I will remember the deeds of Yah. Surely I will remember your wonders from long ago.

content: 12 I will also muse on all your work, and meditate on your deeds.
content_old: 12 I will also muse on all your work, and meditate on your deeds.

content: 13 O God, your way is distinctive. Who is a great god like our God?
content_old: 13 O God, your way is distinctive. Who is a great god like our God?

content: 14 You are the God who works wonders; you have made known your might among the peoples.
content_old: 14 You are the God who works wonders; you have made known your might among the peoples.

content: 15 With your arm you redeemed your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
content_old: 15 With your arm you redeemed your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

content: 16 Waters saw you, O God; waters saw you and they trembled. Surely the deeps shook.
content_old: 16 Waters saw you, O God; waters saw you and they trembled. Surely the deeps shook.

content: 17 The clouds poured out water. The skies thundered. Your arrows also flew about.
content_old: 17 The clouds poured out water. The skies thundered. Your arrows also flew about.

content: 18 The sound of your thunder was in the whirlwind; lightnings lit the world; the earth shook and quaked.
content_old: 18 The sound of your thunder was in the whirlwind; lightnings lit the world; the earth shook and quaked.

content: 19 Your way was through the sea, and your path through many waters. Yet your footprints were not discerned.
content_old: 19 Your way was through the sea, and your path through many waters. Yet your footprints were not discerned.

content: A maskil of Asaph.
content_old: A maskil of Asaph.

content: 1 Listen, O my people, to my teaching. Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
content_old: 1 Listen, O my people, to my teaching. Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.

content: 2 I will offer a parable with my mouth. I will pour out riddles from long ago,
content_old: 2 I will offer a parable with my mouth. I will pour out riddles from long ago,

content: 3 that we have heard and known, and our ancestors have told us.
content_old: 3 that we have heard and known, and our ancestors have told us.

content: 4 We will not hide them from their children, telling the next generation the praises of Yahweh, and his power and his wonders that he has done.
content_old: 4 We will not hide them from their children, telling the next generation the praises of Yahweh, and his power and his wonders that he has done.

content: 5 For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our ancestors to teach to their children,
content_old: 5 For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law in Israel, which he commanded our ancestors to teach to their children,

content: 6 so that the next generation might know— children yet to be born— that they might rise up and tell their children,
content_old: 6 so that the next generation might know— children yet to be born— that they might rise up and tell their children,

content: 7 that they might set their confidence in God, and not forget the deeds of God, but keep his commandments,
content_old: 7 that they might set their confidence in God, and not forget the deeds of God, but keep his commandments,

content: 8 and not be like their ancestors, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that did not make ready its heart, whose spirit was not faithful to God.
content_old: 8 and not be like their ancestors, a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that did not make ready its heart, whose spirit was not faithful to God.

content: 9 The sons of Ephraim, armed with archers, turned back on the day of battle.
content_old: 9 The sons of Ephraim, armed with archers, turned back on the day of battle.

content: 10 They did not keep the covenant of God and refused to go in his law.
content_old: 10 They did not keep the covenant of God and refused to go in his law.

content: 11 They also forgot his deeds, and his wonders that he had shown them.
content_old: 11 They also forgot his deeds, and his wonders that he had shown them.

content: 12 In front of their ancestors he did a wonder, in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
content_old: 12 In front of their ancestors he did a wonder, in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.

content: 13 He split the sea and caused them to go over, and he caused waters to stand like a heap.
content_old: 13 He split the sea and caused them to go over, and he caused waters to stand like a heap.

content: 14 And he led them with the cloud by day, and all night with a fiery light.
content_old: 14 And he led them with the cloud by day, and all night with a fiery light.

content: 15 He caused rocks to split in the wilderness and provided drink abundantly as from the depths.
content_old: 15 He caused rocks to split in the wilderness and provided drink abundantly as from the depths.

content: 16 And he brought streams out of the rock and caused water to flow down like rivers.
content_old: 16 And he brought streams out of the rock and caused water to flow down like rivers.

content: 17 But they sinned still further against him by rebelling against the Most High in the desert.
content_old: 17 But they sinned still further against him by rebelling against the Most High in the desert.

content: 18 And they tested God in their heart by asking food for their craving.
content_old: 18 And they tested God in their heart by asking food for their craving.

content: 19 And they spoke against God. They said, “Is God able to prepare a table in the wilderness?
content_old: 19 And they spoke against God. They said, “Is God able to prepare a table in the wilderness?

content: 20 Yes, he struck the rock and water flowed and streams gushed out, but can he also give food or provide meat for his people?”
content_old: 20 Yes, he struck the rock and water flowed and streams gushed out, but can he also give food or provide meat for his people?”

content: 21 Therefore Yahweh heard and he was very angry, and a fire was kindled against Jacob, and his anger also rose up against Israel,
content_old: 21 Therefore Yahweh heard and he was very angry, and a fire was kindled against Jacob, and his anger also rose up against Israel,

content: 22 because they did not believe God, and they did not trust his salvation.
content_old: 22 because they did not believe God, and they did not trust his salvation.

content: 23 Nevertheless, he commanded the skies above and opened the doors of heaven,
content_old: 23 Nevertheless, he commanded the skies above and opened the doors of heaven,

content: 24 and rained down on them manna to eat and gave them the grain of heaven.
content_old: 24 and rained down on them manna to eat and gave them the grain of heaven.

content: 25 Humankind ate the bread of angels. He sent them food enough to be satisfied.
content_old: 25 Humankind ate the bread of angels. He sent them food enough to be satisfied.

content: 26 He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens and drove along the south wind by his strength.
content_old: 26 He caused the east wind to blow in the heavens and drove along the south wind by his strength.

content: 27 Then he rained meat on them like dust, even winged birds like the sand of the seas.
content_old: 27 Then he rained meat on them like dust, even winged birds like the sand of the seas.

content: 28 He caused them to fall in the midst of his camp, all around his dwellings.
content_old: 28 He caused them to fall in the midst of his camp, all around his dwellings.

content: 29 So they ate and were well filled, and he brought about what they craved.
content_old: 29 So they ate and were well filled, and he brought about what they craved.

content: 30 They had not yet turned aside from their craving, while their food was still in their mouth,
content_old: 30 They had not yet turned aside from their craving, while their food was still in their mouth,

content: 31 the anger of God rose against them, and he killed some of the stoutest of them, even the young men of Israel he caused to bow down in death.
content_old: 31 the anger of God rose against them, and he killed some of the stoutest of them, even the young men of Israel he caused to bow down in death.

content: 32 In spite of all this they sinned further and did not believe his wonders.
content_old: 32 In spite of all this they sinned further and did not believe his wonders.

content: 33 And he consumed their days with futility their years with terror.
content_old: 33 And he consumed their days with futility their years with terror.

content: 34 When he killed some of them, then they sought him, and repented and earnestly sought God.
content_old: 34 When he killed some of them, then they sought him, and repented and earnestly sought God.

content: 35 And they remembered that God was their rock, and God Most High their redeemer.
content_old: 35 And they remembered that God was their rock, and God Most High their redeemer.

content: 36 But they enticed him with their mouth and lied to him with their tongue.
content_old: 36 But they enticed him with their mouth and lied to him with their tongue.

content: 37 For their heart was not steadfast with him, nor were they faithful to his covenant.
content_old: 37 For their heart was not steadfast with him, nor were they faithful to his covenant.

content: 38 But he was compassionate; he pardoned their guilt and did not destroy them. And many times he turned back his anger and did not stir up all his wrath,
content_old: 38 But he was compassionate; he pardoned their guilt and did not destroy them. And many times he turned back his anger and did not stir up all his wrath,

content: 39 for he remembered that they were flesh, a passing wind that does not return.
content_old: 39 for he remembered that they were flesh, a passing wind that does not return.

content: 40 How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness and vexed him in the wasteland!
content_old: 40 How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness and vexed him in the wasteland!

content: 41 So they again tested God and distressed the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 41 So they again tested God and distressed the Holy One of Israel.

content: 42 And they did not remember his power when he redeemed them from the enemy,
content_old: 42 And they did not remember his power when he redeemed them from the enemy,

content: 43 how he performed his signs in Egypt and his wonders in the region of Zoan,
content_old: 43 how he performed his signs in Egypt and his wonders in the region of Zoan,

content: 44 when he turned their rivers to blood so they could not drink from their streams.
content_old: 44 when he turned their rivers to blood so they could not drink from their streams.

content: 45 He sent among them flies that devoured them and frogs that destroyed them.
content_old: 45 He sent among them flies that devoured them and frogs that destroyed them.

content: 46 And he gave their crop to the locusts and their labor to the locust.
content_old: 46 And he gave their crop to the locusts and their labor to the locust.

content: 47 He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore trees with sleet.
content_old: 47 He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore trees with sleet.

content: 48 He also handed their cattle over to the hail and their livestock to the lightning bolts.
content_old: 48 He also handed their cattle over to the hail and their livestock to the lightning bolts.

content: 49 He sent against them his fierce anger, rage and indignation and trouble, a band of destroying angels.
content_old: 49 He sent against them his fierce anger, rage and indignation and trouble, a band of destroying angels.

content: 50 He cleared a path for his anger. He did not spare them from death but handed their life over to the plague.
content_old: 50 He cleared a path for his anger. He did not spare them from death but handed their life over to the plague.

content: 51 And he struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, the first of their virility in the tents of Ham.
content_old: 51 And he struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, the first of their virility in the tents of Ham.

content: 52 Then he led out his people like sheep and guided them like a herd in the wilderness.
content_old: 52 Then he led out his people like sheep and guided them like a herd in the wilderness.

content: 53 And he led them safely and they were not afraid, but the sea covered their enemies.
content_old: 53 And he led them safely and they were not afraid, but the sea covered their enemies.

content: 54 So he brought them to his holy territory, this mountain his right hand acquired.
content_old: 54 So he brought them to his holy territory, this mountain his right hand acquired.

content: 55 And he drove out nations before them and allocated them for an inheritance by boundary line, and settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.
content_old: 55 And he drove out nations before them and allocated them for an inheritance by boundary line, and settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.

content: 56 But they tested and rebelled against God Most High and did not keep his statutes.
content_old: 56 But they tested and rebelled against God Most High and did not keep his statutes.

content: 57 And they turned and were treacherous like their ancestors. They twisted like a crooked bow.
content_old: 57 And they turned and were treacherous like their ancestors. They twisted like a crooked bow.

content: 58 For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and made him jealous with their images.
content_old: 58 For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and made him jealous with their images.

content: 59 God heard and he was very angry and rejected Israel utterly.
content_old: 59 God heard and he was very angry and rejected Israel utterly.

content: 60 So he abandoned the dwelling place at Shiloh, the tent he had placed among humankind.
content_old: 60 So he abandoned the dwelling place at Shiloh, the tent he had placed among humankind.

content: 61 And he gave his strength into captivity and his splendor into the hand of the enemy.
content_old: 61 And he gave his strength into captivity and his splendor into the hand of the enemy.

content: 62 He also handed his people over to the sword, and he was very angry with his inheritance.
content_old: 62 He also handed his people over to the sword, and he was very angry with his inheritance.

content: 63 Fire devoured his young men, and his young women were not praised.
content_old: 63 Fire devoured his young men, and his young women were not praised.

content: 64 His priests fell by the sword, and his widows did not weep.
content_old: 64 His priests fell by the sword, and his widows did not weep.

content: 65 Then the Lord awoke like one who had been asleep, awoke like a warrior who had been drunk with wine.
content_old: 65 Then the Lord awoke like one who had been asleep, awoke like a warrior who had been drunk with wine.

content: 66 And he beat back his enemies; he gave them over to perpetual scorn.
content_old: 66 And he beat back his enemies; he gave them over to perpetual scorn.

content: 67 And he rejected the tent of Joseph, and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
content_old: 67 And he rejected the tent of Joseph, and did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,

content: 68 but chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion that he loved.
content_old: 68 but chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion that he loved.

content: 69 And he built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that he established forever.
content_old: 69 And he built his sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that he established forever.

content: 70 And he chose David his servant and took him from the sheepfolds.
content_old: 70 And he chose David his servant and took him from the sheepfolds.

content: 71 He brought him from following nursing ewes to shepherd Jacob, his people, and Israel, his inheritance.
content_old: 71 He brought him from following nursing ewes to shepherd Jacob, his people, and Israel, his inheritance.

content: A psalm of Asaph.
content_old: A psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 O God, the nations have entered your inheritance; they have defiled your holy temple; they have reduced Jerusalem to ruins.
content_old: 1 O God, the nations have entered your inheritance; they have defiled your holy temple; they have reduced Jerusalem to ruins.

content: 2 They have given the bodies of your servants as food for the birds of the heavens, the flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the earth.
content_old: 2 They have given the bodies of your servants as food for the birds of the heavens, the flesh of your faithful to the beasts of the earth.

content: 3 They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.
content_old: 3 They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.

content: 4 We have become a taunt to our neighbors, a derision and a scorn to those around us.
content_old: 4 We have become a taunt to our neighbors, a derision and a scorn to those around us.

content: 5 How long, O Yahweh? Will you be angry forever? Will your jealousy burn like fire?
content_old: 5 How long, O Yahweh? Will you be angry forever? Will your jealousy burn like fire?

content: 6 Pour out your anger on the nations that do not know you, and on the kingdoms that do not call on your name,
content_old: 6 Pour out your anger on the nations that do not know you, and on the kingdoms that do not call on your name,

content: 7 because they have devoured Jacob and have laid waste his habitation.
content_old: 7 because they have devoured Jacob and have laid waste his habitation.

content: 8 Do not remember against us former iniquities; let your mercies meet us quickly because we are brought very low.
content_old: 8 Do not remember against us former iniquities; let your mercies meet us quickly because we are brought very low.

content: 9 Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your name; and deliver us and forgive our sins for the sake of your name.
content_old: 9 Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your name; and deliver us and forgive our sins for the sake of your name.

content: 10 Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Let it be known among the nations before our eyes, by the avenging of the blood of your servants that was poured out.
content_old: 10 Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Let it be known among the nations before our eyes, by the avenging of the blood of your servants that was poured out.

content: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come before you. According to the greatness of your power, spare the children appointed to death.
content_old: 11 Let the groaning of the prisoner come before you. According to the greatness of your power, spare the children appointed to death.

content: 12 And return to our neighbors sevenfold upon them their taunts with which they taunted you, O Lord.
content_old: 12 And return to our neighbors sevenfold upon them their taunts with which they taunted you, O Lord.

content: For the music director, according to The Lilies. A testimony. Of Asaph. A psalm.
content_old: For the music director, according to The Lilies. A testimony. Of Asaph. A psalm.

content: 1 Give ear, O shepherd of Israel, who leads Joseph like a flock. Shine forth, you who sits enthroned above the cherubim.
content_old: 1 Give ear, O shepherd of Israel, who leads Joseph like a flock. Shine forth, you who sits enthroned above the cherubim.

content: 2 Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your power and come for our salvation.
content_old: 2 Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, stir up your power and come for our salvation.

content: 3 O God, restore us, and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
content_old: 3 O God, restore us, and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.

content: 4 O Yahweh God of hosts, how long will you be angry against the prayer of your people?
content_old: 4 O Yahweh God of hosts, how long will you be angry against the prayer of your people?

content: 5 You have fed them the bread of tears; you have given them tears to drink in full measure.
content_old: 5 You have fed them the bread of tears; you have given them tears to drink in full measure.

content: 6 You have made us an object of strife to our neighbors, and our enemies mock among themselves.
content_old: 6 You have made us an object of strife to our neighbors, and our enemies mock among themselves.

content: 7 O God of hosts, restore us and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.
content_old: 7 O God of hosts, restore us and cause your face to shine that we may be saved.

content: 8 You uprooted a vine from Egypt; you drove out the nations and planted it.
content_old: 8 You uprooted a vine from Egypt; you drove out the nations and planted it.

content: 9 You prepared a place before it, and it took deep root and filled the land.
content_old: 9 You prepared a place before it, and it took deep root and filled the land.

content: 10 The mountains were covered with its shade, and the mighty cedars with its boughs.
content_old: 10 The mountains were covered with its shade, and the mighty cedars with its boughs.

content: 11 It spread its branches to the sea and its shoots to the river.
content_old: 11 It spread its branches to the sea and its shoots to the river.

content: 12 Why have you broken down its walls, so that all who pass on the road pluck fruit from it?
content_old: 12 Why have you broken down its walls, so that all who pass on the road pluck fruit from it?

content: 13 Swine from the forests devour it and creatures of the field feed on it.
content_old: 13 Swine from the forests devour it and creatures of the field feed on it.

content: 14 Please return, O God of hosts. Observe from heaven and see, and pay attention to this vine,
content_old: 14 Please return, O God of hosts. Observe from heaven and see, and pay attention to this vine,

content: 15 even the stalk that your right hand planted, and concerning the shoot you strengthened for yourself.
content_old: 15 even the stalk that your right hand planted, and concerning the shoot you strengthened for yourself.

content: 16 It is burned with fire, cut down. They perish at the rebuke of your face.
content_old: 16 It is burned with fire, cut down. They perish at the rebuke of your face.

content: 17 Let your hand be on the man of your right hand, on the son of humankind whom you made strong for yourself.
content_old: 17 Let your hand be on the man of your right hand, on the son of humankind whom you made strong for yourself.

content: 18 Then we will not turn back from you. Restore us to life, and we will proclaim your name.
content_old: 18 Then we will not turn back from you. Restore us to life, and we will proclaim your name.

content: For the music director; on the Gittith. Of Asaph.
content_old: For the music director; on the Gittith. Of Asaph.

content: 1 Shout out to God our strength; shout joyfully to the God of Jacob.
content_old: 1 Shout out to God our strength; shout joyfully to the God of Jacob.

content: 2 Lift up a song and strike the tambourine, the pleasant lyre, together with the harp.
content_old: 2 Lift up a song and strike the tambourine, the pleasant lyre, together with the harp.

content: 3 Blow the horn at new moon, at full moon, for our feast day,
content_old: 3 Blow the horn at new moon, at full moon, for our feast day,

content: 4 because it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
content_old: 4 because it is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

content: 5 He made it a statute in Joseph when he went out against the land of Egypt, where I heard a language I did not know.
content_old: 5 He made it a statute in Joseph when he went out against the land of Egypt, where I heard a language I did not know.

content: 6 “I removed his shoulder from a burden. His hands were freed from the basket.
content_old: 6 “I removed his shoulder from a burden. His hands were freed from the basket.

content: 7 In this trouble you called, and I rescued you. Within the secret place of thunder I answered you; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah
content_old: 7 In this trouble you called, and I rescued you. Within the secret place of thunder I answered you; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah

content: 8 Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you; O Israel, if you would but listen to me.
content_old: 8 Hear, O my people, and I will admonish you; O Israel, if you would but listen to me.

content: 9 There shall be no strange god among you, and you shall not bow down to a foreign god.
content_old: 9 There shall be no strange god among you, and you shall not bow down to a foreign god.

content: 10 I am Yahweh your God, who brought you up from the land of Egypt. Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.
content_old: 10 I am Yahweh your God, who brought you up from the land of Egypt. Open wide your mouth and I will fill it.

content: 11 But my people did not listen to my voice, and Israel did not yield to me.
content_old: 11 But my people did not listen to my voice, and Israel did not yield to me.

content: 12 So I let them go in the stubbornness of their heart; they walked in their counsels.
content_old: 12 So I let them go in the stubbornness of their heart; they walked in their counsels.

content: 13 Oh that my people would listen to me; that Israel would walk in my ways.
content_old: 13 Oh that my people would listen to me; that Israel would walk in my ways.

content: 14 I would subdue their enemies quickly, and turn my hand against their adversaries.
content_old: 14 I would subdue their enemies quickly, and turn my hand against their adversaries.

content: 15 Those who hate Yahweh would cringe before him, and their fate would be forever.
content_old: 15 Those who hate Yahweh would cringe before him, and their fate would be forever.

content: A psalm of Asaph.
content_old: A psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 God stands in the divine assembly; he administers judgment in the midst of the gods.
content_old: 1 God stands in the divine assembly; he administers judgment in the midst of the gods.

content: 2 “How long will you judge unjustly and show favoritism to the wicked? Selah
content_old: 2 “How long will you judge unjustly and show favoritism to the wicked? Selah

content: 3 Judge on behalf of the helpless and the orphan; provide justice to the afflicted and the poor.
content_old: 3 Judge on behalf of the helpless and the orphan; provide justice to the afflicted and the poor.

content: 4 Rescue the helpless and the needy; deliver them from the hand of the wicked.”
content_old: 4 Rescue the helpless and the needy; deliver them from the hand of the wicked.”

content: 5 They do not know or consider. They go about in the darkness, so that all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
content_old: 5 They do not know or consider. They go about in the darkness, so that all the foundations of the earth are shaken.

content: 6 I have said, “You are gods, and sons of the Most High, all of you.
content_old: 6 I have said, “You are gods, and sons of the Most High, all of you.

content: 7 However, you will die like men, and you will fall like one of the princes.”
content_old: 7 However, you will die like men, and you will fall like one of the princes.”

content: A song. A psalm of Asaph.
content_old: A song. A psalm of Asaph.

content: 1 O God, do not rest silently. Do not keep silent or be still, O God.
content_old: 1 O God, do not rest silently. Do not keep silent or be still, O God.

content: 2 For look, your enemies roar, and those who hate you have lifted their head.
content_old: 2 For look, your enemies roar, and those who hate you have lifted their head.

content: 3 They devise cunning schemes against your people, and consult together against your protected ones.
content_old: 3 They devise cunning schemes against your people, and consult together against your protected ones.

content: 4 They say, “Come, let us annihilate them from being a nation, so that the name of Israel will be remembered no more.”
content_old: 4 They say, “Come, let us annihilate them from being a nation, so that the name of Israel will be remembered no more.”

content: 5 For they have consulted together with a unified purpose. They have made a covenant against you:
content_old: 5 For they have consulted together with a unified purpose. They have made a covenant against you:

content: 6 the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,
content_old: 6 the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,

content: 7 Gebal and Ammon and Amalek, Philistia, with the inhabitants of Tyre.
content_old: 7 Gebal and Ammon and Amalek, Philistia, with the inhabitants of Tyre.

content: 8 Assyria also has joined with them. They provide help to the children of Lot. Selah
content_old: 8 Assyria also has joined with them. They provide help to the children of Lot. Selah

content: 9 Do to them as you did with Midian, as with Sisera, as with Jabin at the wadi of Kishon.
content_old: 9 Do to them as you did with Midian, as with Sisera, as with Jabin at the wadi of Kishon.

content: 10 They were destroyed at En-dor; they became dung for the ground.
content_old: 10 They were destroyed at En-dor; they became dung for the ground.

content: 11 Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their chiefs like Zebah and Zalmunna,
content_old: 11 Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their chiefs like Zebah and Zalmunna,

content: 12 who said, “Let us take as our possession the pastures of God.”
content_old: 12 who said, “Let us take as our possession the pastures of God.”

content: 13 O my God, make them like the tumbleweed, like the chaff before wind.
content_old: 13 O my God, make them like the tumbleweed, like the chaff before wind.

content: 14 As fire burns a forest, and as a flame sets afire mountains,
content_old: 14 As fire burns a forest, and as a flame sets afire mountains,

content: 15 so pursue them with your tempest and terrify them with your storm.
content_old: 15 so pursue them with your tempest and terrify them with your storm.

content: 16 Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek your name, O Yahweh.
content_old: 16 Fill their faces with shame, that they may seek your name, O Yahweh.

content: 17 Let them be ashamed and terrified forever, and let them be humiliated and perish
content_old: 17 Let them be ashamed and terrified forever, and let them be humiliated and perish

content: For the music director; on the Gittith. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.
content_old: For the music director; on the Gittith. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.

content: 1 How lovely are your dwelling places, O Yahweh of hosts!
content_old: 1 How lovely are your dwelling places, O Yahweh of hosts!

content: 2 My soul longs and even fails for the courtyards of Yahweh. My heart and flesh sing for joy to the living God.
content_old: 2 My soul longs and even fails for the courtyards of Yahweh. My heart and flesh sing for joy to the living God.

content: 3 Even a bird finds a home, and a swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, near your altars, O Yahweh of hosts, my king and my God.
content_old: 3 Even a bird finds a home, and a swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young, near your altars, O Yahweh of hosts, my king and my God.

content: 4 Blessed are those who dwell in your house; they can ever praise you. Selah
content_old: 4 Blessed are those who dwell in your house; they can ever praise you. Selah

content: 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in you; in their heart are the highways to Zion.
content_old: 5 Blessed is the man whose strength is in you; in their heart are the highways to Zion.

content: 6 Passing through the Valley of Baca, they make it a spring. The early rain covers it with blessings as well.
content_old: 6 Passing through the Valley of Baca, they make it a spring. The early rain covers it with blessings as well.

content: 7 They go from strength to strength, until each appears before God in Zion.
content_old: 7 They go from strength to strength, until each appears before God in Zion.

content: 8 O Yahweh, God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah
content_old: 8 O Yahweh, God of hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah

content: 9 Look at our shield, O God, and have regard for the face of your anointed one.
content_old: 9 Look at our shield, O God, and have regard for the face of your anointed one.

content: 10 Because better is a day in your courtyards than a thousand elsewhere. I would rather be at the threshold of the house of my God than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.
content_old: 10 Because better is a day in your courtyards than a thousand elsewhere. I would rather be at the threshold of the house of my God than to dwell in the tents of wickedness.

content: 11 Because Yahweh God is a sun and a shield; Yahweh gives grace and honor. He does not withhold good from those who walk blamelessly.
content_old: 11 Because Yahweh God is a sun and a shield; Yahweh gives grace and honor. He does not withhold good from those who walk blamelessly.

content: For the music director. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.
content_old: For the music director. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.

content: 1 O Yahweh, you favored your land. You restored the fortunes of Jacob.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, you favored your land. You restored the fortunes of Jacob.

content: 2 You took away the guilt of your people; you covered all their sin. Selah
content_old: 2 You took away the guilt of your people; you covered all their sin. Selah

content: 3 You withdrew all your wrath; you turned from your burning anger.
content_old: 3 You withdrew all your wrath; you turned from your burning anger.

content: 4 Restore us, O God of our salvation, and annul your vexation with us.
content_old: 4 Restore us, O God of our salvation, and annul your vexation with us.

content: 5 Will you be angry against us forever? Will you prolong your anger generation after generation?
content_old: 5 Will you be angry against us forever? Will you prolong your anger generation after generation?

content: 6 Will you not again revive us, that your people might rejoice in you?
content_old: 6 Will you not again revive us, that your people might rejoice in you?

content: 7 Show us, O Yahweh, your loyal love, and grant us your salvation.
content_old: 7 Show us, O Yahweh, your loyal love, and grant us your salvation.

content: 8 I will hear what God, Yahweh, will speak, because he will speak peace to his people, even his faithful ones, but let them not return to folly.
content_old: 8 I will hear what God, Yahweh, will speak, because he will speak peace to his people, even his faithful ones, but let them not return to folly.

content: 9 Surely his salvation is near for those who fear him, that glory may abide in our land.
content_old: 9 Surely his salvation is near for those who fear him, that glory may abide in our land.

content: 10 Loyal love and faithfulness will meet one another; righteousness and peace will kiss.
content_old: 10 Loyal love and faithfulness will meet one another; righteousness and peace will kiss.

content: 11 Faithfulness will sprout from the ground, and righteousness will look down from heaven.
content_old: 11 Faithfulness will sprout from the ground, and righteousness will look down from heaven.

content: 12 Yes, Yahweh will give what is good, and our land will give its produce.
content_old: 12 Yes, Yahweh will give what is good, and our land will give its produce.

content: A prayer of David.
content_old: A prayer of David.

content: 1 Incline, O Yahweh, your ear and answer me, because I am poor and needy.
content_old: 1 Incline, O Yahweh, your ear and answer me, because I am poor and needy.

content: 2 Watch over my life because I am faithful. You are my God; save your servant. I am the one who trusts you.
content_old: 2 Watch over my life because I am faithful. You are my God; save your servant. I am the one who trusts you.

content: 3 Be gracious to me, O Lord, because I call to you all day long.
content_old: 3 Be gracious to me, O Lord, because I call to you all day long.

content: 4 Make glad the soul of your servant, because I desire you, O Lord.
content_old: 4 Make glad the soul of your servant, because I desire you, O Lord.

content: 5 For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving, and abundant in loyal love for all who call to you.
content_old: 5 For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving, and abundant in loyal love for all who call to you.

content: 6 Heed, O Yahweh, my prayer, and attend to the voice of my supplications.
content_old: 6 Heed, O Yahweh, my prayer, and attend to the voice of my supplications.

content: 7 In the day of my trouble I call to you, because you answer me.
content_old: 7 In the day of my trouble I call to you, because you answer me.

content: 8 There is none like you among the gods, O Lord, and there are no works like yours.
content_old: 8 There is none like you among the gods, O Lord, and there are no works like yours.

content: 9 All the nations that you have made will come and bow down before you, O Lord, and glorify your name.
content_old: 9 All the nations that you have made will come and bow down before you, O Lord, and glorify your name.

content: 10 For you are great and doing wondrous things; you alone are God.
content_old: 10 For you are great and doing wondrous things; you alone are God.

content: 11 Teach me, O Yahweh, your way, that I may walk in your truth. Unite my heart to fear your name.
content_old: 11 Teach me, O Yahweh, your way, that I may walk in your truth. Unite my heart to fear your name.

content: 12 I will give you thanks, O Lord my God, with all my heart, and glorify your name forever,
content_old: 12 I will give you thanks, O Lord my God, with all my heart, and glorify your name forever,

content: 13 because your loyal love is great toward me, and you will have delivered my life from Sheol below.
content_old: 13 because your loyal love is great toward me, and you will have delivered my life from Sheol below.

content: 14 O God, arrogant men have risen up against me, even a gang of ruthless men seek my life, but they do not set you before them.
content_old: 14 O God, arrogant men have risen up against me, even a gang of ruthless men seek my life, but they do not set you before them.

content: 15 But you, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger and abundant in loyal love and faithfulness.
content_old: 15 But you, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger and abundant in loyal love and faithfulness.

content: 16 Turn to me and be gracious to me. Give your strength to your servant, and grant victory to the son of your maidservant.
content_old: 16 Turn to me and be gracious to me. Give your strength to your servant, and grant victory to the son of your maidservant.

content: Of the sons of Korah. A psalm. A song.
content_old: Of the sons of Korah. A psalm. A song.

content: 1 His foundation is on the holy mountains.
content_old: 1 His foundation is on the holy mountains.

content: 2 Yahweh loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
content_old: 2 Yahweh loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

content: 3 Glorious things are spoken about you, O city of God. Selah
content_old: 3 Glorious things are spoken about you, O city of God. Selah

content: 4 I will record those who know me in Rahab and Babylon, behold in Philistia and Tyre with Cush, “This one was born there.”
content_old: 4 I will record those who know me in Rahab and Babylon, behold in Philistia and Tyre with Cush, “This one was born there.”

content: 5 But with respect to Zion it shall be said, “Each one was born in her,” for the Most High himself will establish her.
content_old: 5 But with respect to Zion it shall be said, “Each one was born in her,” for the Most High himself will establish her.

content: 6 Yahweh will record in writing the peoples, “This one was born there.” Selah
content_old: 6 Yahweh will record in writing the peoples, “This one was born there.” Selah

content: A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. For the music director; according to Mahalath Leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.
content_old: A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. For the music director; according to Mahalath Leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.

content: 1 O Yahweh, God of my salvation, I cry out by day and through the night before you.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, God of my salvation, I cry out by day and through the night before you.

content: 2 Let my prayer come before you; incline your ear to my cry.
content_old: 2 Let my prayer come before you; incline your ear to my cry.

content: 3 For my soul is full with troubles, and my life approaches Sheol.
content_old: 3 For my soul is full with troubles, and my life approaches Sheol.

content: 4 I am reckoned with those descending to the pit. I am like a man without strength,
content_old: 4 I am reckoned with those descending to the pit. I am like a man without strength,

content: 5 set free among the dead, like the slain lying in the grave, whom you no longer remember, even those cut off from your hand.
content_old: 5 set free among the dead, like the slain lying in the grave, whom you no longer remember, even those cut off from your hand.

content: 6 You have set me in the pit below, in dark places, in the depths.
content_old: 6 You have set me in the pit below, in dark places, in the depths.

content: 7 Your wrath presses upon me, and you afflict me with all your waves. Selah
content_old: 7 Your wrath presses upon me, and you afflict me with all your waves. Selah

content: 8 You have removed my acquaintances far from me. You have made me detestable to them. I am confined and cannot go out.
content_old: 8 You have removed my acquaintances far from me. You have made me detestable to them. I am confined and cannot go out.

content: 9 My eye languishes from misery. I call on you, O Yahweh, every day; I spread out my hands to you.
content_old: 9 My eye languishes from misery. I call on you, O Yahweh, every day; I spread out my hands to you.

content: 10 Do you work wonders for the dead? Or do the departed spirits rise up to praise you? Selah
content_old: 10 Do you work wonders for the dead? Or do the departed spirits rise up to praise you? Selah

content: 11 Is your loyal love told in the grave, or your faithfulness in the underworld?
content_old: 11 Is your loyal love told in the grave, or your faithfulness in the underworld?

content: 12 Are your wonders known in the darkness, or your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
content_old: 12 Are your wonders known in the darkness, or your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?

content: 13 But as for me, I cry for help to you, O Yahweh, and in the morning my prayer comes before you.
content_old: 13 But as for me, I cry for help to you, O Yahweh, and in the morning my prayer comes before you.

content: 14 Why do you reject my soul, O Yahweh? Why do you hide your face from me?
content_old: 14 Why do you reject my soul, O Yahweh? Why do you hide your face from me?

content: 15 I am afflicted and perishing from my youth. I bear your terrors. I am distraught.
content_old: 15 I am afflicted and perishing from my youth. I bear your terrors. I am distraught.

content: 16 Your burning anger has passed over me; your sudden fears have destroyed me.
content_old: 16 Your burning anger has passed over me; your sudden fears have destroyed me.

content: 17 They surround me like water all the day; they circle about me altogether.
content_old: 17 They surround me like water all the day; they circle about me altogether.

content: A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
content_old: A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.

content: 1 I will sing forever of Yahweh’s acts of loyal love. From generation to generation I will make known your faithfulness with my mouth.
content_old: 1 I will sing forever of Yahweh’s acts of loyal love. From generation to generation I will make known your faithfulness with my mouth.

content: 2 For I say, “Forever your loyal love is built up. The heavens you have established with your faithfulness in them.”
content_old: 2 For I say, “Forever your loyal love is built up. The heavens you have established with your faithfulness in them.”

content: 3 “I made a covenant with my chosen one; I swore an oath to David my servant:
content_old: 3 “I made a covenant with my chosen one; I swore an oath to David my servant:

content: 4 ‘I will establish your descendants forever, and I will build up your throne from generation to generation.’ ” Selah
content_old: 4 ‘I will establish your descendants forever, and I will build up your throne from generation to generation.’ ” Selah

content: 5 And so the heavens will praise your wonderful deed, O Yahweh, even your faithfulness, in the assembly of the holy ones.
content_old: 5 And so the heavens will praise your wonderful deed, O Yahweh, even your faithfulness, in the assembly of the holy ones.

content: 6 For who in the sky is equal to Yahweh? Who is like Yahweh among the sons of God,
content_old: 6 For who in the sky is equal to Yahweh? Who is like Yahweh among the sons of God,

content: 7 a God feared greatly in the council of the holy ones, and awesome above all surrounding him?
content_old: 7 a God feared greatly in the council of the holy ones, and awesome above all surrounding him?

content: 8 O Yahweh God of hosts, who is mighty like you, O Yah, with your faithfulness surrounding you?
content_old: 8 O Yahweh God of hosts, who is mighty like you, O Yah, with your faithfulness surrounding you?

content: 9 You are ruling the surging of the sea. When its waves rise, you yourself still them.
content_old: 9 You are ruling the surging of the sea. When its waves rise, you yourself still them.

content: 10 You yourself crushed Rahab like one who is slain; you scattered your enemies with your strong arm.
content_old: 10 You yourself crushed Rahab like one who is slain; you scattered your enemies with your strong arm.

content: 11 The heavens are yours, the earth yours as well, the world with its fullness, because you founded them.
content_old: 11 The heavens are yours, the earth yours as well, the world with its fullness, because you founded them.

content: 12 North and south, you created them; Tabor and Hermon shout joyfully over your name.
content_old: 12 North and south, you created them; Tabor and Hermon shout joyfully over your name.

content: 13 You have a mighty arm; Your hand is strong; your right hand reaches high.
content_old: 13 You have a mighty arm; Your hand is strong; your right hand reaches high.

content: 14 Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. Loyal love and faithfulness come before your face.
content_old: 14 Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. Loyal love and faithfulness come before your face.

content: 15 Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout; O Yahweh, they walk about in the light of your countenance.
content_old: 15 Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout; O Yahweh, they walk about in the light of your countenance.

content: 16 In your name they rejoice all the day, and in your righteousness they rise up.
content_old: 16 In your name they rejoice all the day, and in your righteousness they rise up.

content: 17 For you are the glory of their strength, and by your favor our horn rises up,
content_old: 17 For you are the glory of their strength, and by your favor our horn rises up,

content: 18 because our shield belongs to Yahweh, and our king to the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 18 because our shield belongs to Yahweh, and our king to the Holy One of Israel.

content: 19 Formerly you spoke in a vision to your faithful ones, and said, “I have bestowed help on a mighty man; I have exalted one chosen from the people.
content_old: 19 Formerly you spoke in a vision to your faithful ones, and said, “I have bestowed help on a mighty man; I have exalted one chosen from the people.

content: 20 I have found David, my servant. With my holy oil I have anointed him,
content_old: 20 I have found David, my servant. With my holy oil I have anointed him,

content: 21 with whom my hand will be steadfast. Surely my arm will strengthen him.
content_old: 21 with whom my hand will be steadfast. Surely my arm will strengthen him.

content: 22 The enemy will not deceive him, and no evil man will afflict him.
content_old: 22 The enemy will not deceive him, and no evil man will afflict him.

content: 23 But I will crush his adversaries before him, and I will strike those who hate him.
content_old: 23 But I will crush his adversaries before him, and I will strike those who hate him.

content: 24 And so my faithfulness and my loyal love will be with him, and in my name his horn will rise up.
content_old: 24 And so my faithfulness and my loyal love will be with him, and in my name his horn will rise up.

content: 25 And I will set his hand on the sea and his right hand on the rivers.
content_old: 25 And I will set his hand on the sea and his right hand on the rivers.

content: 26 He will call out to me, ‘You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.’
content_old: 26 He will call out to me, ‘You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.’

content: 27 I will also make him the firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
content_old: 27 I will also make him the firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.

content: 28 Forever I will keep my loyal love for him, and my covenant will be reliable for him.
content_old: 28 Forever I will keep my loyal love for him, and my covenant will be reliable for him.

content: 29 I will also establish his offspring forever, and his throne as the days of the heavens.
content_old: 29 I will also establish his offspring forever, and his throne as the days of the heavens.

content: 30 If his sons forsake my law and do not walk in my judgments,
content_old: 30 If his sons forsake my law and do not walk in my judgments,

content: 31 if they defile my statutes and do not keep my commandments,
content_old: 31 if they defile my statutes and do not keep my commandments,

content: 32 then I will punish their transgression with a rod, and their guilt with wounds.
content_old: 32 then I will punish their transgression with a rod, and their guilt with wounds.

content: 33 But I will not break off my loyal love from him, and I will not be false against my faithfulness.
content_old: 33 But I will not break off my loyal love from him, and I will not be false against my faithfulness.

content: 34 I will not defile my covenant, or alter what proceeded from my lips.
content_old: 34 I will not defile my covenant, or alter what proceeded from my lips.

content: 35 Once I have sworn by my holiness, ‘I will surely not lie to David,
content_old: 35 Once I have sworn by my holiness, ‘I will surely not lie to David,

content: 36 His offspring will endure forever, and his throne as the sun before me.
content_old: 36 His offspring will endure forever, and his throne as the sun before me.

content: 37 Like the moon it will be steadfast forever, and like an enduring witness in the sky.’ ” Selah
content_old: 37 Like the moon it will be steadfast forever, and like an enduring witness in the sky.’ ” Selah

content: 38 But you have spurned and rejected; you are very angry with your anointed one.
content_old: 38 But you have spurned and rejected; you are very angry with your anointed one.

content: 39 You have repudiated the covenant with your servant; you have defiled his crown in the dirt.
content_old: 39 You have repudiated the covenant with your servant; you have defiled his crown in the dirt.

content: 40 You have broken down all his walls; you have made his fortifications a ruin.
content_old: 40 You have broken down all his walls; you have made his fortifications a ruin.

content: 41 All passing along the road plunder him; he has become a taunt to his neighbors.
content_old: 41 All passing along the road plunder him; he has become a taunt to his neighbors.

content: 42 You have raised the right hand of his adversaries. You have made all his enemies rejoice.
content_old: 42 You have raised the right hand of his adversaries. You have made all his enemies rejoice.

content: 43 You have also turned back the edge of his sword and have not helped him stand his ground in the battle.
content_old: 43 You have also turned back the edge of his sword and have not helped him stand his ground in the battle.

content: 44 You have made his splendor to cease, and cast his throne to the ground.
content_old: 44 You have made his splendor to cease, and cast his throne to the ground.

content: 45 You have cut short the days of his youth; you have covered him with shame. Selah
content_old: 45 You have cut short the days of his youth; you have covered him with shame. Selah

content: 46 How long, O Yahweh? Will you hide yourself forever? Will your wrath burn like fire forever?
content_old: 46 How long, O Yahweh? Will you hide yourself forever? Will your wrath burn like fire forever?

content: 47 Remember what my lifespan is. Remember for what vanity you have created all the children of humankind.
content_old: 47 Remember what my lifespan is. Remember for what vanity you have created all the children of humankind.

content: 48 What man can live on and not see death? Can he deliver his life from the power of Sheol? Selah
content_old: 48 What man can live on and not see death? Can he deliver his life from the power of Sheol? Selah

content: 49 Where are your former acts of loyal love, O Lord, that you swore to David by your faithfulness?
content_old: 49 Where are your former acts of loyal love, O Lord, that you swore to David by your faithfulness?

content: 50 Remember, O Lord the taunting of your servants, how I bear in my bosom the taunts of all the many peoples,
content_old: 50 Remember, O Lord the taunting of your servants, how I bear in my bosom the taunts of all the many peoples,

content: 51 by which your enemies taunt, O Yahweh, by which they taunt the steps of your anointed one.
content_old: 51 by which your enemies taunt, O Yahweh, by which they taunt the steps of your anointed one.

content: A prayer of Moses, the man of God.
content_old: A prayer of Moses, the man of God.

content: 1 O Lord, you have been our help in all generations.
content_old: 1 O Lord, you have been our help in all generations.

content: 2 Before the mountains were born and you brought forth the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.
content_old: 2 Before the mountains were born and you brought forth the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.

content: 3 You return man to the dust, saying, “Return, O sons of man.”
content_old: 3 You return man to the dust, saying, “Return, O sons of man.”

content: 4 For a thousand years in your eyes are like yesterday when it passes, or like a watch in the night.
content_old: 4 For a thousand years in your eyes are like yesterday when it passes, or like a watch in the night.

content: 5 You sweep them away like a flood. They fall asleep. In the morning they are like grass that sprouts anew.
content_old: 5 You sweep them away like a flood. They fall asleep. In the morning they are like grass that sprouts anew.

content: 6 In the morning it blossoms and sprouts anew; by evening it withers and dries up.
content_old: 6 In the morning it blossoms and sprouts anew; by evening it withers and dries up.

content: 7 For we are brought to an end by your anger, and we hasten off by your wrath.
content_old: 7 For we are brought to an end by your anger, and we hasten off by your wrath.

content: 8 You have put our iniquities before you, our hidden sins into the light of your countenance.
content_old: 8 You have put our iniquities before you, our hidden sins into the light of your countenance.

content: 9 For all of our days dwindle away in your rage; we complete our years like a sigh.
content_old: 9 For all of our days dwindle away in your rage; we complete our years like a sigh.

content: 10 As for the days of our years, within them are seventy years or if by strength eighty years, and their pride is trouble and disaster, for it passes quickly and we fly away.
content_old: 10 As for the days of our years, within them are seventy years or if by strength eighty years, and their pride is trouble and disaster, for it passes quickly and we fly away.

content: 11 Who knows the strength of your anger, and your rage consistent with the fear due you?
content_old: 11 Who knows the strength of your anger, and your rage consistent with the fear due you?

content: 12 So teach us to number our days that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
content_old: 12 So teach us to number our days that we may gain a heart of wisdom.

content: 13 Return, O Yahweh. How long? And have compassion on your servants.
content_old: 13 Return, O Yahweh. How long? And have compassion on your servants.

content: 14 Satisfy us in the morning with your loyal love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
content_old: 14 Satisfy us in the morning with your loyal love, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.

content: 15 Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen calamity.
content_old: 15 Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen calamity.

content: 16 Let your work be visible to your servants, and your majesty to their children.
content_old: 16 Let your work be visible to your servants, and your majesty to their children.

content: 1 One who lives in the secret place of the Most High will lodge in the shadow of Shaddai.
content_old: 1 One who lives in the secret place of the Most High will lodge in the shadow of Shaddai.

content: 2 I will say to Yahweh, “You are my refuge and my fortress, my God in whom I trust.”
content_old: 2 I will say to Yahweh, “You are my refuge and my fortress, my God in whom I trust.”

content: 3 For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, from the plague of destruction.
content_old: 3 For he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, from the plague of destruction.

content: 4 With his feathers he will cover you, and under his wings you can take refuge. His faithfulness will be a shield and a buckler.
content_old: 4 With his feathers he will cover you, and under his wings you can take refuge. His faithfulness will be a shield and a buckler.

content: 5 You need not fear the terror of the night, or the arrow that flies by day,
content_old: 5 You need not fear the terror of the night, or the arrow that flies by day,

content: 6 or the plague that spreads in the darkness, or the destruction that devastates at noon.
content_old: 6 or the plague that spreads in the darkness, or the destruction that devastates at noon.

content: 7 A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.
content_old: 7 A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.

content: 8 You will only look with your eyes, and see the punishment of the wicked.
content_old: 8 You will only look with your eyes, and see the punishment of the wicked.

content: 9 For you, O Yahweh, are my refuge. You have made the Most High your dwelling place.
content_old: 9 For you, O Yahweh, are my refuge. You have made the Most High your dwelling place.

content: 10 No harm will befall you, and no plague will come near your tent.
content_old: 10 No harm will befall you, and no plague will come near your tent.

content: 11 For he will command his angels concerning you, to watch over you in all your ways.
content_old: 11 For he will command his angels concerning you, to watch over you in all your ways.

content: 12 In their hands they will bear you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.
content_old: 12 In their hands they will bear you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.

content: 13 You will tread on lion and viper; you will trample young lion and serpent.
content_old: 13 You will tread on lion and viper; you will trample young lion and serpent.

content: 14 Because he loves me, therefore I will deliver him; I will protect him because he knows my name.
content_old: 14 Because he loves me, therefore I will deliver him; I will protect him because he knows my name.

content: 15 He will call upon me and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue and honor him.
content_old: 15 He will call upon me and I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble; I will rescue and honor him.

content: A psalm. A song. For the Sabbath day.
content_old: A psalm. A song. For the Sabbath day.

content: 1 It is good to give thanks to Yahweh, and to sing praise concerning your name, O Most High;
content_old: 1 It is good to give thanks to Yahweh, and to sing praise concerning your name, O Most High;

content: 2 to declare in the morning your loyal love and your faithfulness in the night,
content_old: 2 to declare in the morning your loyal love and your faithfulness in the night,

content: 3 on the ten string, and on the harp, with a melody on the lyre.
content_old: 3 on the ten string, and on the harp, with a melody on the lyre.

content: 4 For you, O Yahweh, have made me glad by your work; by the deeds of your hands I sing for joy.
content_old: 4 For you, O Yahweh, have made me glad by your work; by the deeds of your hands I sing for joy.

content: 5 How great are your deeds, O Yahweh; how very deep are your thoughts.
content_old: 5 How great are your deeds, O Yahweh; how very deep are your thoughts.

content: 6 The brutish man does not know, and the fool cannot understand this.
content_old: 6 The brutish man does not know, and the fool cannot understand this.

content: 7 When the wicked flourish like grass and all the workers of evil blossom, it is so they can be destroyed forever.
content_old: 7 When the wicked flourish like grass and all the workers of evil blossom, it is so they can be destroyed forever.

content: 8 But you are on high forever, O Yahweh.
content_old: 8 But you are on high forever, O Yahweh.

content: 9 For behold, your enemies, O Yahweh, for behold, your enemies will perish. All the workers of evil will be scattered.
content_old: 9 For behold, your enemies, O Yahweh, for behold, your enemies will perish. All the workers of evil will be scattered.

content: 10 But you have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox; you have anointed me with fresh oil.
content_old: 10 But you have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox; you have anointed me with fresh oil.

content: 11 And so my eye looks on my enemies. My ears hear those evildoers who rise up against me.
content_old: 11 And so my eye looks on my enemies. My ears hear those evildoers who rise up against me.

content: 12 The righteous will flourish like the date palm. They will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
content_old: 12 The righteous will flourish like the date palm. They will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

content: 13 Planted in the house of Yahweh, they will flourish in the courts of our God.
content_old: 13 Planted in the house of Yahweh, they will flourish in the courts of our God.

content: 14 They will still prosper in old age. They will be fat and luxuriant,
content_old: 14 They will still prosper in old age. They will be fat and luxuriant,

content: 1 Yahweh is king; he clothes himself with majesty. Yahweh clothes himself; he girds himself with might. Yes, the world is established so that it will not be moved.
content_old: 1 Yahweh is king; he clothes himself with majesty. Yahweh clothes himself; he girds himself with might. Yes, the world is established so that it will not be moved.

content: 2 Your throne is established from of old; you are from everlasting.
content_old: 2 Your throne is established from of old; you are from everlasting.

content: 3 The rivers have lifted up, O Yahweh; the rivers have lifted up their rumbling; the rivers have lifted up their pounding.
content_old: 3 The rivers have lifted up, O Yahweh; the rivers have lifted up their rumbling; the rivers have lifted up their pounding.

content: 4 Mightier than the rumblings of many waters, mightier than the mighty breakers of the sea, Yahweh on high is mighty.
content_old: 4 Mightier than the rumblings of many waters, mightier than the mighty breakers of the sea, Yahweh on high is mighty.

content: 1 O Yahweh, God of vengeance, God of vengeance, shine forth.
content_old: 1 O Yahweh, God of vengeance, God of vengeance, shine forth.

content: 2 Rise up, O Judge of the earth. Repay upon the proud what is their rightful due.
content_old: 2 Rise up, O Judge of the earth. Repay upon the proud what is their rightful due.

content: 3 How long will the wicked, O Yahweh, how long will the wicked exult?
content_old: 3 How long will the wicked, O Yahweh, how long will the wicked exult?

content: 4 They gush words unrestrained. All the evildoers boast.
content_old: 4 They gush words unrestrained. All the evildoers boast.

content: 5 They crush your people, O Yahweh; they oppress your inheritance.
content_old: 5 They crush your people, O Yahweh; they oppress your inheritance.

content: 6 They kill widow and stranger, and they murder orphans,
content_old: 6 They kill widow and stranger, and they murder orphans,

content: 7 while they say, “Yah does not see,” and “The God of Jacob does not pay attention.”
content_old: 7 while they say, “Yah does not see,” and “The God of Jacob does not pay attention.”

content: 8 You pay attention, O brutes among the people. And you fools, when will you show insight?
content_old: 8 You pay attention, O brutes among the people. And you fools, when will you show insight?

content: 9 Will the one who planted the ear not hear? Will the one who formed the eye not see?
content_old: 9 Will the one who planted the ear not hear? Will the one who formed the eye not see?

content: 10 Will the one who instructs nations not rebuke, the one who teaches humankind knowledge?
content_old: 10 Will the one who instructs nations not rebuke, the one who teaches humankind knowledge?

content: 11 Yahweh knows the thoughts of humankind, that they are to no purpose.
content_old: 11 Yahweh knows the thoughts of humankind, that they are to no purpose.

content: 12 Blessed is the man, O Yah, whom you instruct and teach from your law,
content_old: 12 Blessed is the man, O Yah, whom you instruct and teach from your law,

content: 13 to give him rest from days of trouble, until a pit is dug for the wicked.
content_old: 13 to give him rest from days of trouble, until a pit is dug for the wicked.

content: 14 For Yahweh will not abandon his people, nor forsake his inheritance.
content_old: 14 For Yahweh will not abandon his people, nor forsake his inheritance.

content: 15 For judgment will return to righteousness, and all the upright in heart will follow after it.
content_old: 15 For judgment will return to righteousness, and all the upright in heart will follow after it.

content: 16 Who rose up for me against the wicked? Who stood up for me against the workers of iniquity?
content_old: 16 Who rose up for me against the wicked? Who stood up for me against the workers of iniquity?

content: 17 If Yahweh had not been my help, my soul would soon have dwelt in silence.
content_old: 17 If Yahweh had not been my help, my soul would soon have dwelt in silence.

content: 18 When I thought, “My foot is slipping,” your loyal love, O Yahweh, supported me.
content_old: 18 When I thought, “My foot is slipping,” your loyal love, O Yahweh, supported me.

content: 19 When my troubled thoughts were many within me, your consolations cheered my soul.
content_old: 19 When my troubled thoughts were many within me, your consolations cheered my soul.

content: 20 Can there be allied with you a throne of destruction, one that forms trouble based on statute?
content_old: 20 Can there be allied with you a throne of destruction, one that forms trouble based on statute?

content: 21 They band together against the life of the righteous, and declare the blameless guilty of blood.
content_old: 21 They band together against the life of the righteous, and declare the blameless guilty of blood.

content: 22 But Yahweh has become my high stronghold, and my God has become my rock of refuge.
content_old: 22 But Yahweh has become my high stronghold, and my God has become my rock of refuge.

content: 1 Come, let us sing for joy to Yahweh; let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
content_old: 1 Come, let us sing for joy to Yahweh; let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.

content: 2 Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving; with songs let us shout joyfully to him.
content_old: 2 Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving; with songs let us shout joyfully to him.

content: 3 For Yahweh is the great God, and the great king over all gods,
content_old: 3 For Yahweh is the great God, and the great king over all gods,

content: 4 in whose hand are the unexplored places of the earth, and the heights of the mountains are his,
content_old: 4 in whose hand are the unexplored places of the earth, and the heights of the mountains are his,

content: 5 to whom belongs the sea that he made, and the dry land that his hands formed.
content_old: 5 to whom belongs the sea that he made, and the dry land that his hands formed.

content: 6 Come in, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before Yahweh, our maker.
content_old: 6 Come in, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before Yahweh, our maker.

content: 7 For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. Today if you will hear his voice:
content_old: 7 For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. Today if you will hear his voice:

content: 8 “Do not harden your heart as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
content_old: 8 “Do not harden your heart as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,

content: 9 when your ancestors tried me. They put me to the test, even though they had seen my work.
content_old: 9 when your ancestors tried me. They put me to the test, even though they had seen my work.

content: 10 For forty years I loathed that generation, and said, ‘They are a people whose heart wanders. And my ways they do not know.’
content_old: 10 For forty years I loathed that generation, and said, ‘They are a people whose heart wanders. And my ways they do not know.’

content: 1 Sing to Yahweh a new song; sing to Yahweh, all the earth.
content_old: 1 Sing to Yahweh a new song; sing to Yahweh, all the earth.

content: 2 Sing to Yahweh; bless his name. Announce his salvation from day to day.
content_old: 2 Sing to Yahweh; bless his name. Announce his salvation from day to day.

content: 3 Tell his glory among the nations, his marvelous works among all the peoples.
content_old: 3 Tell his glory among the nations, his marvelous works among all the peoples.

content: 4 For Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods.
content_old: 4 For Yahweh is great and very worthy of praise; he is to be feared above all gods.

content: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but Yahweh made the heavens.
content_old: 5 For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but Yahweh made the heavens.

content: 6 Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
content_old: 6 Splendor and majesty are before him; strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.

content: 7 Ascribe to Yahweh, you families of the peoples, ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.
content_old: 7 Ascribe to Yahweh, you families of the peoples, ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.

content: 8 Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due his name; bring an offering and come into his courts.
content_old: 8 Ascribe to Yahweh the glory due his name; bring an offering and come into his courts.

content: 9 Worship Yahweh in holy array; tremble before him, all the earth.
content_old: 9 Worship Yahweh in holy array; tremble before him, all the earth.

content: 10 Say among the nations, “Yahweh is king! Yes, the world is established so that it will not be moved. He will judge the peoples fairly.”
content_old: 10 Say among the nations, “Yahweh is king! Yes, the world is established so that it will not be moved. He will judge the peoples fairly.”

content: 11 Let the heavens be glad and the earth rejoice. Let the sea with its fullness roar.
content_old: 11 Let the heavens be glad and the earth rejoice. Let the sea with its fullness roar.

content: 12 Let the field with all that is in it exult. Then all the trees of the forests will sing for joy
content_old: 12 Let the field with all that is in it exult. Then all the trees of the forests will sing for joy

content: 1 Yahweh is king! Let the earth rejoice; let many coastlands be glad.
content_old: 1 Yahweh is king! Let the earth rejoice; let many coastlands be glad.

content: 2 Cloud and thick darkness are surrounding him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
content_old: 2 Cloud and thick darkness are surrounding him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

content: 3 Fire goes before him, and devours his enemies round about.
content_old: 3 Fire goes before him, and devours his enemies round about.

content: 4 His lightnings light the world; the earth sees and trembles.
content_old: 4 His lightnings light the world; the earth sees and trembles.

content: 5 The mountains melt like wax at the presence of Yahweh, at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.
content_old: 5 The mountains melt like wax at the presence of Yahweh, at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

content: 6 The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.
content_old: 6 The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory.

content: 7 Let all who serve an image be ashamed, those who boast about idols. Worship him, all you gods.
content_old: 7 Let all who serve an image be ashamed, those who boast about idols. Worship him, all you gods.

content: 8 Zion hears and is glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoice because of your judgments, O Yahweh.
content_old: 8 Zion hears and is glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoice because of your judgments, O Yahweh.

content: 9 For you, O Yahweh, are most high over all the earth. You are highly exalted above all gods.
content_old: 9 For you, O Yahweh, are most high over all the earth. You are highly exalted above all gods.

content: 10 You who love Yahweh, hate evil. He protects the lives of his faithful; he delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
content_old: 10 You who love Yahweh, hate evil. He protects the lives of his faithful; he delivers them from the hand of the wicked.

content: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.
content_old: 11 Light is sown for the righteous, and joy for the upright in heart.

content: A psalm.
content_old: A psalm.

content: 1 Sing to Yahweh a new song, for he has done wonders. His right hand and his holy arm have secured his victory.
content_old: 1 Sing to Yahweh a new song, for he has done wonders. His right hand and his holy arm have secured his victory.

content: 2 Yahweh has made known his salvation; to the eyes of the nations he has revealed his righteousness.
content_old: 2 Yahweh has made known his salvation; to the eyes of the nations he has revealed his righteousness.

content: 3 He has remembered his loyal love and his faithfulness to the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
content_old: 3 He has remembered his loyal love and his faithfulness to the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

content: 4 Shout joyfully to Yahweh, all the earth. Be cheerful and sing for joy and sing praises.
content_old: 4 Shout joyfully to Yahweh, all the earth. Be cheerful and sing for joy and sing praises.

content: 5 Sing praises to Yahweh with lyre, with lyre and melodious sound.
content_old: 5 Sing praises to Yahweh with lyre, with lyre and melodious sound.

content: 6 With trumpets and sound of horn, shout joyfully before the king, Yahweh.
content_old: 6 With trumpets and sound of horn, shout joyfully before the king, Yahweh.

content: 7 Let the sea with its fullness roar, the world and those who live in it.
content_old: 7 Let the sea with its fullness roar, the world and those who live in it.

content: 8 Let the rivers clap their hands. Let the hills sing joyfully together
content_old: 8 Let the rivers clap their hands. Let the hills sing joyfully together

content: 1 Yahweh is king; let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned between the cherubim. Let the earth shake.
content_old: 1 Yahweh is king; let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned between the cherubim. Let the earth shake.

content: 2 Yahweh is great in Zion, and he is exalted over all the peoples.
content_old: 2 Yahweh is great in Zion, and he is exalted over all the peoples.

content: 3 Let them praise your great and fearful name. He is holy.
content_old: 3 Let them praise your great and fearful name. He is holy.

content: 4 And the strength of the king loves justice. You have established equity; you have executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.
